0.title: Actor Sathish called out for commenting on Sunny Leone, Dharsha Gupta's clothes
0.article_body: Actor Sathish was called out for commenting on choice of clothes of his co-stars Dharsha Gupta and Sunny Leone at an event. He commented on Dharsha's crop top-lehenga by comparing it with Sunny Leone's saree. "To...ask...for mass heckling of a crowd by a man on a woman who doesn't dress according to culture. When will this behaviour...stop?" Chinmayi Sripada tweeted.

1.title: 12-yr-old girl killed by dumper truck on her way to school in UP
1.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was crushed to death by a dumper truck when she was on her way to school in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad on Thursday, police said. The girl was on a bicycle when the accident took place. Angry locals staged a protest at the spot and pelted stones at the stranded vehicles, police said.

2.title: Firearms being smuggled to separate North Bengal, says CM Banerjee
2.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday alleged firearms are being smuggled from Bihar and across international borders to separate North Bengal from the state. Banerjee further claimed that the vehicles of VIPs are being used for the purpose and directed the District Magistrates and Police Superintendents to look into the matter to put an end to such attempts.

3.title: Amagi raises $100 mn from General Atlantic, valuation reaches $1.4 bn
3.article_body: Media technology company Amagi has raised $100 million from private equity company General Atlantic valuing the company at $1.4 billion. Founded by Subramanian, Srinivasan KA and Srividhya Srinivasan in 2008, it was valued at $1 billion after its last funding in March 2022. Amagi also announced that it crossed $100 million in annual recurring revenue after a record July-September quarter.

4.title: Over 2 lakh homes without power as hurricane Nicole hits US' Florida
4.article_body: More than 2,10,000 homes and businesses were left without power in the US state of Florida early on Thursday after Hurricane Nicole made landfall into the state's east coast overnight. Reportedly, service to about half of the roughly 4,00,000 customers has been restored. The storm was centred around 95 km southeast of Orlando, in central Florida.

5.title: Rampur court rejects Azam Khan's plea challenging conviction in hate speech case
5.article_body: A Rampur sessions court on Thursday rejected Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan's appeal, challenging his conviction in a hate speech case that led to his disqualification from the UP Assembly. On October 27, the MP-MLA court in Rampur convicted Khan in the hate speech case and sent him to three years in jail.

6.title: U'khand bars production of 5 Patanjali medicines citing 'misleading ads'
6.article_body: The Uttarakhand Ayurveda and Unani Licensing Authority directed Divya Pharmacy, the maker of Patanjali products, to stop the production of medicines, falsely being promoted to treat blood pressure, diabetes, glaucoma and high cholesterol. Citing "misleading advertisements", the authority has also asked Patanjali to submit revised formulation sheets and label claims for fresh approval.

7.title: SC refuses to urgently list plea on stubble burning ban
7.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to urgently list a petition seeking to ban stubble burning to reduce air pollution in Delhi. CJI DY Chandrachud said some genuine solutions are needed and that stubble burning ban cannot be enforced against every farmer across Punjab and Uttar Pradesh. "There are some things courts can do and some things courts cannot do," he added.

8.title: 1.2-kg hairball removed from stomach of Maha girl who ingested own hair
8.article_body: A 32-inch-long rugby ball-shaped hairball weighing 1.2 kg was removed from a 13-year-old girl's stomach after a one-and-a-half hour surgery in Maharashtra's Vasai on Tuesday. The child's condition came to light after she complained of severe abdominal pain and was unable to eat anything without throwing up. A surgeon said she had Rapunzel syndrome, wherein one swallows their own hair.

9.title: 25 persons injured after pickup van overturns in Jharkhand's Dumka
9.article_body: At least 25 people were injured after a pickup van overturned and fell into a roadside ditch while trying to prevent a head-on collision with an auto-rickshaw in Jharkhand's Dumka on Thursday, police said. The injured were returning to Bihar's Katihar after visiting Basukinath temple in Dumka. The condition of two of the injured is serious, a police official said.

10.title: Zomato reports net loss of ₹251 crore in Q2, revenue jumps 62% YoY
10.article_body: Zomato reported a consolidated net loss of ₹250.8 crore in the quarter ended September. The company's consolidated revenue from operations grew by 62.2% to ₹1,661.3 crore as against ₹1,024.2 crore in the year-ago period. Adjusted for its acquisition Blinkit, the revenue grew 48% year-on-year, which translates to annualised revenue of ₹8,576.6 crore ($1.05 billion).

11.title: 2 builders held for cheating people of ₹20 cr through forgery in Hyderabad
11.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday arrested two builders for cheating 20 persons of ₹20 crore through forgery. According to the police, the accused had set up a construction company at Tolichowki in 2016 and would have property agreements with land owners. "Through these papers, the...accused would convince the victims...and take money in the form of deposits," a police statement said.

12.title: Kempegowda's 108 ft statue sets world record, tallest of a city founder
12.article_body: The 108 ft statue of Nadaprabhu Kempegowda, called the 'Statue of Prosperity', set a world record as the "first and tallest bronze statue of a founder of a city". "An apt tribute to Bengaluru's founder Kempegowda," Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai tweeted along with the certificate from the World Book of Records. PM Narendra Modi will unveil the statue on Friday.

13.title: ₹100 crore bribe paid to govt officials for undue benefits in Delhi excise policy: ED
13.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday said various persons involved in the Delhi excise policy scam have revealed that they paid ₹100 crore in bribe to government officials for undue benefits to select business groups. "Delhi government...allowed formation as well as operation of cartelisation...The new excise policy increased the profit margin for L1 wholesalers to 12%," ED added.

14.title: Apple and Amazon sued in US for allegedly fixing iPhone, iPad prices
14.article_body: In a US antitrust lawsuit, Apple and Amazon were accused of conspiring to raise iPhone and iPad prices by removing nearly all other resellers of new Apple products from Amazon's website. The lawsuit claimed Amazon reduced authorised Apple resellers from 600 to seven after a January 2019 agreement, under which Apple gave Amazon up to 10% discounts on its products.

15.title: Cong can make everyone CM candidate, but BJP will win in Himachal: CM
15.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Thursday said the Congress should make everyone its CM candidate, but the BJP is going to win the state elections. "Till date, it is not known...how many leaders are contenders for...CM's post this time," Thakur said. Addressing a rally in Rampur, he said, "Congress leaders make false promises...there's no need to listen to them."

16.title: FTX halts addition of new clients, withdrawals and fresh deposits
16.article_body: FTX has suspended onboarding of new clients, withdrawals as well as fresh deposits until further notice after the company's bail-out deal with Binance collapsed on Thursday. Chief Executive Officer Sam Bankman-Fried has told employees in an internal memo that he was exploring all options to avoid a collapse that analysts have said could trigger a meltdown in the crypto industry.

17.title: India welcomes UK court's decision on Nirav Modi's extradition to India
17.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday welcomed the UK high court's ruling rejecting fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi's appeal against his extradition to India in connection with a bank loan fraud case. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said India has been vigorously pursuing the extradition of economic fugitives so that they face legal process in the country.

18.title: Clash breaks out between 2 groups of students at JNU, men seen walking around with sticks
18.article_body: Some students of Jawaharlal Nehru University in Delhi were seen carrying wooden sticks around the campus on Thursday shortly after a clash broke out between two groups. Two students have been injured in the clash, which took place over a personal dispute. The police are on the spot. However, no complaint has been filed  yet.

19.title: BSNL gets govt's nod for ₹26,821 crore 4G deal with TCS: Report
19.article_body: The central government has reportedly approved the BSNL's ₹26,821 crore deal with TCS to roll out 4G services in India. The report stated that TCS will soon be given the order to purchase 1,00,000 sites for the state-run telco. The IT services provider will set up the 4G lines and maintain the network for the next nine years.

20.title: WeWork to close 40 US locations in a bid to reduce costs
20.article_body: Workspace provider WeWork on Thursday said it will exit about 40 locations across the United States in a bid to cut costs. The closures, affecting nearly 41,000 workstations, are expected to contribute roughly $140 million to annual adjusted core earnings, WeWork said. The New York-based firm announced a net loss of $629 million in third quarter.

21.title: Hales used dimensions of ground well, was brilliant vs India: Buttler
21.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler, speaking about batter Alex Hales' performance against India in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, said, "Hales used the dimensions [of the ground] well and he has shown his form." He added that Hales was brilliant against India. Hales and Buttler stitched an unbeaten 170-run partnership to beat India by 10 wickets.

22.title: Musk's fans build ₹4.8 crore statue of his head with body of a goat, pic goes viral
22.article_body: Elon Musk's fans have created a 30-foot long aluminium statue with a goat body riding a rocket. The statue is worth $6,00,000 (₹4.8 crore) and will also fit in a 24-carat gold-plated thunder sign on the goat's body. It's crafted by Canadian metal sculptors Kevin and Michelle Stone. The statue has been commissioned by the cryptocurrency firm Elon GOAT Token.

23.title: New road linking B'luru's IT hub Mahadevapura to airport to be ready soon
23.article_body: Bengaluru civic body is set to construct a new route to connect the airport in Devanahalli with the IT hub in Mahadevapura. The new route is expected to decongest the Mekhri Circle-Devanahalli route, which will connect to Terminal 2 of the city's airport. Notably, PM Narendra Modi, who will visit Bengaluru on November 11, will inaugurate the new terminal.

24.title: Thanks to PM for believing in her: Jadeja as his wife gets BJP ticket
24.article_body: Indian cricketer Ravindra Jadeja on Thursday thanked PM Narendra Modi after his wife Rivaba Jadeja was given BJP's ticket to contest Gujarat Assembly elections from Jamnagar North constituency. He said, "[Thanks] our honourable PM Shri Narendra Modi...and Shri Amit Shah...for believing in her abilities." Jadeja also congratulated his wife saying, "So proud of all the effort...which you've put in."

25.title: So, this Sunday, it's 152/0 vs 170/0: Pak PM after England beat India by 10 wickets
25.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif took a dig at Team India after England defeated them by 10 wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final in Adelaide on Thursday. He tweeted, "So, this Sunday, it's: 152/0 vs 170/0." He referred to targets chased by Pakistan and England against India in T20 World Cup 2021 and T20 World Cup 2022, respectively.

26.title: Amazon becomes world's first public company to lose $1 tn in market value
26.article_body: Amazon has become the world's first publicly traded company to lose $1 trillion in market value, Bloomberg reported. A combination of rising inflation, tightening monetary policies and disappointing earnings triggered a "historic" selloff in Amazon's stock this year. Amazon's shares fell 4.3% on Wednesday, pushing its market value to $879 billion from a record $1.88 trillion on July 2021.

27.title: Ashneer to launch his autobiography titled 'Doglapan: The Hard Truth...'
27.article_body: Entrepreneur and 'Shark Tank India' investor Ashneer Grover will launch his autobiography this December, titled, "Doglapan: The Hard Truth about Life and Start-ups". Grover said the book is "all about the hypocrisy of life – success in failure and failure in success". He added, "This is my real-life story, one which has left me with a lot more experience."

28.title: Never thought I'd play in World Cup again: Hales after his knock vs India
28.article_body: After his knock against India in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, England batter Alex Hales said that he never thought he would play in the World Cup again. "To get the chance [in the World Cup] is a very special feeling...Jos Buttler was unbelievable," he added. Hales scored an unbeaten 47-ball 86 and was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

29.title: Dharma won: Suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh as he walks out of jail
29.article_body: Suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh walked out of a Hyderabad jail on Wednesday. After his release, Singh tweeted, "Dharma (religion) has won. I'm at your service once again. Jai Shri Ram." Singh was imprisoned for around 75 days for his remarks against Prophet Muhammad. While ordering his release, the Telangana High Court barred him from conducting rallies or press meets.

30.title: Dropout rates in primary schools doubled due to COVID-19: Assam minister
30.article_body: The dropout rates in Assam's primary schools in 2021-22 have doubled due to COVID-19 and identification of fake students' rolls, state Education Minister Ranoj Pegu said on Wednesday. However, the dropout rate at secondary level has declined from 31% in 2020-21 to 20.3% in 2021-22, he added. A survey identified that the number of total dropout students is 1.29 lakh.

31.title: Railway Protection Force rescues 539 children in 10 months in Mumbai
31.article_body: Railway Protection Force's (RPF) Mumbai Division rescued as many as 539 children between January and October 2022, the highest tally among all Central Railway (CR) divisions. The RPF rescued 1,236 children during the same period in total. Under 'Operation Nanhe Farishte', the RPF has been rescuing children, providing counselling to them and reuniting them with their families.

32.title: Kerala govt declares Sabarimala, nearby areas as 'liquor and drug-free zone'
32.article_body: The Kerala government has declared the premises of Lord Ayyappa Temple at Sabarimala as "liquor and drug-free zone" from November 14 to January 22, 2023, on account of Mandalam-Makaravilakku festival. Besides the temple complex, consumption and sale of alcohol, drugs, and tobacco have also been banned in Pamba, Triveni, Marakoottam, Sabari Peedam and other areas in Perinadu and Kollamula villages.

33.title: My back is almost fixed after 8 months of rehab: Vijay Deverakonda
33.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda took to his Instagram Stories and revealed that his back is "almost fixed" after eight months of rehabilitation. "The beast is dying to come out. Has been kept caged too long now. Go hard and outwork everyone my loves," he added. Vijay last featured in 'Liger', where he played a mixed martial arts fighter.

34.title: 23-yr-old man beaten, robbed of ₹3,700 while walking home in Pune
34.article_body: A 23-year-old man was waylaid and robbed of ₹3,700 while walking home on Sunday night in Pune. Akash Pawar was approached by three bike-borne men near a school in Ambegaon Khurd. They took Akash to a nearby place and beat him on his head before robbing him. "The accused [ran away] from the spot...No arrests have been made," police said.

35.title: Railway proposes Vande Bharat train on Bengaluru-Hubballi route
35.article_body: South Western Railway (SWR) has written to the Railway Board to run a Vande Bharat train service on Bengaluru-Hubballi route. Notably, PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first such train in southern India, which will ply from Mysuru to Chennai via Bengaluru tomorrow. The trial run of the Vande Bharat Express from Chennai to Mysuru was conducted earlier this week.

36.title: Tea Board seeks ₹1,000 crore aid for industry for next 5 years
36.article_body: The Tea Board has sought an assistance of ₹1,000 crore for the industry in the next five years starting 2022-23. Chairman of Tea Board Saurav Pahari said that the budget submitted to Commerce Ministry intends to handhold the small tea growers, who contribute to 52% of India's production volumes. Pahari said the board also sought subsidy for orthodox tea production.

37.title: Rajasthan CM Gehlot urges people to send suggestions for next budget
37.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday urged people to send their suggestions for next year's budget. "It has been decided to dedicate the budget of the upcoming financial year 2023-24 to the youth," he tweeted. "For the last budget also, about 45,000 suggestions were received. All your suggestions are invited. Suggestions can be sent till December 31," he added.

38.title: B'luru Police issues advisory for airport-goers ahead of PM Modi's visit
38.article_body: Bengaluru police issued an advisory for people going to the Kempegowda International Airport on Friday when Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit the city. "All airport passengers...are advised not to use the airport corridor in view of dignitaries movement," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (North Bengaluru) Savitha S. Instead, passengers are advised to use the airport rear gate.

39.title: Pair of lions to arrive at Mumbai's SGNP from Gujarat by November-end
39.article_body: Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) will get a new pair of lions from Gujarat's Sakkarbaug Zoo by the end of November, Maharashtra Forest Minister Sudhir Mungantiwar said on Wednesday. The lion safari at SGNP may receive more visitors after the arrival of the two lions, he added. Currently, there is only one male lion at the national park.

40.title: UP's Pilibhit Tiger Reserve gets 4 elephants from Karnataka
40.article_body: The Pilibhit Tiger Reserve in Uttar Pradesh on Wednesday got four elephants from Karnataka to check incidents of human-wildlife conflict in rural areas adjacent to the forest. These elephants will provide special help to rescue the tigers who come out of the reserve, PTR Deputy Director Naveen Khandelwal said. Eight mahouts have also been brought to look after these elephants.

41.title: MTNL plans to raise up to ₹7,000 crore via 10-year bonds: Report
41.article_body: Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd (MTNL) is reportedly planning to raise ₹7,000 crore through government of India-guaranteed bonds maturing in 10 years or on November 15, 2032. The total size of the issue consists of a  ₹500-crore base issue and  ₹6,500 crore in greenshoe. Bidding for the bonds will take place on November 14 on BSE's electronic bidding platform.

42.title: Cong is not a democratic party, it's a party born out of dynasty: Shah
42.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh, said, "Congress is not a democratic party, it's a party born out of dynasty." In an apparent reference to Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Shah said, "Do you see anything besides 'mother-son' when you look at Congress minutely? There's a 'mother-son' in Delhi as well as Himachal."

43.title: Would've preferred Chahal or Bishnoi over Ashwin: Farokh Engineer
43.article_body: Former India player Farokh Engineer has opined that he would have preferred playing Yuzvendra Chahal or Ravi Bishnoi over Ravichandran Ashwin in the T20 World Cup 2022. "I would've played them a game or two earlier, not in the semi-final straightaway...To win a World Cup you need a leg-spinner...we don't have one in the team right now," he added.

44.title: Musk to allow Twitter users to make digital payments: Report
44.article_body: Elon Musk has reportedly shared his digital payment plans with advertisers, where users will be able to send money to others like China's WeChat. According to a report, Musk said users would be able to extract their funds to authenticated bank accounts and could be offered a high-yield money market account to encourage them to move their cash to Twitter.

45.title: Bengaluru police bust gang issuing fake passports
45.article_body: Bengaluru City Police has bust a gang issuing fake passports. The police said they arrested five Sri Lankan nationals who were ready to pay in the range of ₹50,000 to ₹1,50,000 for the fake documents. The arrested Sri Lankans were looking to shift to the Middle East for job opportunities. The key accused in the case is absconding.

46.title: Hurricane Nicole makes landfall in US' Florida
46.article_body: Hurricane Nicole made landfall in the US state of Florida on Thursday. The storm was centered around 95 km southeast of Orlando, in central Florida. At the time of landfall, the Category 1 Hurricane recorded maximum windspeed of up to 120 km/h. Officials in Florida have ordered the closure of airports and theme parks.

47.title: Elevation Capital to offload $125 mn stake in NSE: Report
47.article_body: Elevation Capital will reportedly sell stake of nearly $125 million in the National Stock Exchange (NSE) amid delay in the exchange's initial public offering (IPO). It will continue to hold shares worth $250 million even after the sale. In 2007, Elevation Capital along with General Atlantic, the NYSE Group and Goldman Sachs acquired a 5% stake each in the NSE.

48.title: Sanjay Raut's courage is appreciated, he is fighter's friend: Uddhav
48.article_body: A day after Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut was granted bail in a money-laundering case, former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said, "I thank the God of justice for the judgement that the court gave." He said, "Sanjay Raut's courage is appreciated. He's...my best friend. A friend is one who fights unwaveringly in times of crisis. This is the fighter's friend."

49.title: Truck driver beaten with belts, iron rods by 8 bike-borne men in Pune
49.article_body: Eight bike-borne men assaulted a 31-year-old truck driver with belts and iron rods for honking at them in Pune. "They smashed the windscreen of the mini-truck and threw away my bag of clothes and documents," the victim said. The police arrested five people, including two minors after the incident came to light.

50.title: 4 children die of measles amid outbreak in Mumbai slums
50.article_body: Four children, including a 13-month-old baby, have died of measles in Mumbai. Out of this, one child died in October, while the remaining three deaths were reported within 48 hours this week. The Health Ministry also sent a multi-disciplinary team to the city after an outbreak of the disease was reported in Dharavi, Govandi, Kurla, Mahim, Bandra and Matunga slums.

51.title: Vir Das' B'luru show cancelled after objection from right-wing group
51.article_body: Comedian Vir Das's show in Bengaluru scheduled for November 10 has been cancelled reportedly after right-wing group Janajagruthi Vedike filed a complaint stating his comments about women and PM Modi "denigrated the nation". Das took to Instagram to apologise for the cancellation and said, "Due to unavoidable circumstances we are pushing the Bengaluru show. New details and dates soon."

52.title: Don't mind India losing, but I do mind India not showing up today: Tharoor on T20 WC exit
52.article_body: Reacting to India crashing out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing to England in the semi-final, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "I don't mind India losing: victory & defeat are part of sports. But I do mind India not showing up today." England chased down the 169-run target in 16 overs without losing any wicket.

53.title: You can't go & teach people how to handle pressure: Rohit after India crash out of T20 WC
53.article_body: After India crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 by losing to England in the semi-final, captain Rohit Sharma said, "You cannot go and teach people how to handle pressure." He added, "Lot of these guys play under pressure in IPL and some of them are able to handle that. When it comes to knockouts, it is about keeping calm."

54.title: BJP objects as Cong names 1984-riots accused Jagdish Tytler in MCD poll committee
54.article_body: BJP has objected to Congress' decision of inducting 1984 anti-Sikh riots accused Jagdish Tytler in their committee for Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections. The voting for 250 wards in Delhi will take place on December 4. Congress had earlier faced criticism from BJP for inviting Tytler as a special guest in the oath ceremony of Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge.

55.title: Changing Guj poll list won't heal Morbi, COVID-19 wounds: Cong to BJP
55.article_body: Criticising BJP for dropping senior leaders from its first list of candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections, Congress on Thursday said that changing candidates won't heal the wounds of the Morbi bridge tragedy. Furthermore, it won't hide the corruption and government inaction seen during the COVID-19 pandemic. Congress' Alok Sharma was referring to Vijay Rupani and RC Faldu, among others.

56.title: Video shows Prez Murmu walking 2 kms to seek Lord Jagannath's blessings
56.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu, who is on a two-day trip to her home state Odisha, stopped her convoy and walked around 2 kilometres to reach the Jagannath temple to offer her prayers on Thursday. In a video of the incident, President Murmu can be seen walking to the temple with Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan and other senior officials.

57.title: Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba thanks PM on getting BJP ticket for Guj polls
57.article_body: After getting BJP's ticket to contest Gujarat Assembly elections from Jamnagar North constituency, cricketer Ravindrasinh Jadeja's wife Rivaba Jadeja said, "The issue of progress and development is important." "I'll like to express my gratitude to PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah...that the party has shown faith in me," she added. BJP announced the names of candidates for 160 constituencies today.

58.title: Prabhas approached for the role of Dev in 'Brahmastra 2': Report
58.article_body: Actor Prabhas has reportedly been approached for the role of Dev in the second instalment of the 'Brahmastra' trilogy. This comes after reports of Hrithik Roshan, Ranveer Singh, Yash and Vijay Deverakonda being approached for the role have surfaced. 'Brahmastra', directed by Ayan Mukerji, featured Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. Shah Rukh Khan had a cameo in the film.

59.title: Flipkart burnt over $3.7 bn cash in about a year
59.article_body: Flipkart burnt over $3.7 billion cash in about one year ending September 2022, according to regulatory filings. In July 2021, the e-commerce platform raised $3.6 billion which has been completely exhausted and reportedly marks the biggest cash burn in one year by a new-age company in India. Flipkart India's consolidated net loss in financial year 2021-22 increased to ₹3,413 crore.

60.title: Easiest run chase in history?: Guinness World Records as England beat India
60.article_body: Guinness World Records' official Twitter handle on Thursday tweeted, "Easiest run chase in history?" The tweet came as England restricted India to 168/6 in their 20 overs and chased down the target in 16 overs without losing any wickets in the T20 World Cup semi-final at Adelaide. Several Twitter users reacted to the tweet, with one saying, "Yeah for sure."

61.title: White Venture Capital to help ex-founders, executives build startups
61.article_body: White Venture Capital has announced a programme for executives and former startup founders who want to build a new venture. Founder of the venture capital firm, Sweta Rau, said, "We will give (them) incubation support, $500,000, our networks in fintech and market knowledge." Her husband Amrish Rau, who is also Pine Labs CEO, is an investment advisor at the company.

62.title: I've done many bad films, prayed that they don't release: Neena
62.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta remembered that there was a time when she had to do what she was offered. But now, even though the options aren't many, she feels fortunate that she's getting good scripts. She admitted that back in the day, she did many bad films and had prayed that they don't release. Neena's upcoming release is Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'.

63.title: Don't Eng openers believe in seeing off the new ball?: Dodda Ganesh
63.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh took an apparent dig at India openers Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul's approach, tweeting, "Don't the English openers believe in assessing...conditions and seeing off the new ball?" England openers Jos Buttler and Alex Hales stitched an unbeaten partnership of 170 runs in England's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against India, helping them win by 10 wickets.

64.title: upGrad's FY22 loss increases to ₹626 cr, employee costs surge
64.article_body: Edtech startup upGrad's net loss widened to ₹626 crore in the financial year 2021-2022 from a loss of ₹211.1 crore in the previous year, according to financial data accessed by business intelligence platform Tofler. upGrad's employee benefit costs jumped to ₹383.16 crore in FY22 from ₹161.5 crore in FY21. upGrad, however, has not laid off any employees in 2022.

65.title: Drone startup Garuda Aerospace raises $5 million from HNIs, others
65.article_body: Garuda Aerospace has raised $5 million from a large infra-development company, a group of HNIs and angel investors from India, the UAE, and Singapore. The company said it would utilise the funds to build advanced drone solutions for the Armed Forces. Recently, Union Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia tweeted about the company and encouraged them for their developments.

66.title: 3 US tourists die at Mexico City Airbnb due to carbon monoxide poisoning
66.article_body: Three American tourists were found dead last week at an Airbnb apartment in Mexico City after apparent carbon monoxide poisoning, authorities said. Kandace Florence, Jordan Marshall and Courtez Hall were in Mexico City to celebrate the Day of the Dead holiday, a report said. Mexico City Attorney General's office has opened an investigation into the case.

67.title: Chanda Kochhar's termination from ICICI Bank valid: Bombay HC
67.article_body: The Bombay High Court said on Thursday that Chanda Kochhar's termination from the post of ICICI Bank's CEO was prima facie a "valid termination". It also dismissed her interim application seeking post-retirement benefits, PTI reported. The High Court bench also ordered Kochhar to not deal with the bank's 6.90 lakh shares she had acquired in 2018.

68.title: It's not losing that hurts, but the manner of losing: Mahindra as India loses to England
68.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman reacted to India's defeat against England in the T20 World Cup semi-final by tweeting, "It's not the losing that hurts, but the manner of losing." He added, "The shifting winds of sport can be cruel...We'll look at it as just another opportunity to rise." England defeated India by 10 wickets and will face Pakistan in the final.

69.title: Rohit tears up after India crash out of T20 World Cup 2022, Dravid consoles him
69.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma was seen in tears after India crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022. A video has gone viral, showing Rohit sitting and controlling his tears. In the video, Rahul Dravid can be seen consoling Rohit. England defeated India in the semi-final by 10 wickets in Adelaide on Thursday.

70.title: Genitals injured after assault by CRPF personnel in jail: Sukesh as he seeks jail transfer
70.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar has written to Delhi LG Vinai Kumar Saxena, alleging that he was assaulted by CRPF personnel inside jail, severely injuring his genitals, and that his wife was also abused. He said he has received threats to withdraw complaints against AAP leaders. Chandrasekhar also asked to transfer him and his wife from "Delhi jail to any other jail".

71.title: First-year MBA student 'physically, mentally tortured' at Pune's SPPU
71.article_body: The mother of a 21-year-old first-year MBA student at Pune's Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has alleged that her daughter and other students were ragged. She claimed the senior students "physically and mentally tortured" her daughter and other students. Meanwhile, the university has ordered an investigation and served warning notices to 17 seniors suspected of being involved in the case.

72.title: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath invests $500,000 in IIT alumni's startup Up
72.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has invested $500,000 in home appliances startup, Up, through its investment arm Rainmatter. Through this, the Bengaluru-based startup has secured a total of $1.3 million in pre-seed funding round. Co-founders of Ather Energy, Unacademy, Entrepreneurs India and Stanford Angels participated in the fundraise. Mahek Mody and Mohit Sharma, IIT Bombay alumni, co-founded Up.

73.title: UP woman fakes pregnancy, gives birth to baby which turns out to be plastic doll
73.article_body: Tired of receiving taunts, a woman in UP gave birth to a premature baby, which turned out to be a plastic doll, reports said. The matter came to light when a doctor at the CHC found that her X-rays and pregnancy papers were fake. The woman had been married for 18 years but had failed to conceive, reports added.

74.title: Adidas to sell Yeezy products under new name after split with Kanye
74.article_body: Adidas has said it plans to continue releasing Yeezy products designed in collaboration with rapper-designer Kanye West without the Yeezy name and branding. Adidas executives announced that the company will make use of their intellectual property rights on the Yeezy brand "as early as 2023". Last month, Adidas ended its partnership with West over his antisemitic remarks.

75.title: ONDC to start beta testing in Delhi on Nov 28: Report
75.article_body: The government's e-commerce network platform, Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) will reportedly start its beta testing phase in Delhi from November 28. ONDC started beta testing phase in Bengaluru two months ago, which focused on groceries, however, in Delhi it will focus on food delivery. In Bengaluru, ONDC participants have been reportedly servicing 50-60 orders per day.

76.title: Salesman hands out resume with chocolate bar and note at traffic signals in Dubai
76.article_body: After failing to find a job online, a salesman named Nawar Moukhalalati started handing out his resume with a chocolate bar and a note at traffic signals in Dubai. The note read, "I will be grateful to you if you help me to get a job. I wish you a beautiful day full of love and happiness."

77.title: Prostitution ring busted in Hyd residential area, 3 detained
77.article_body: A prostitution ring was busted in a residential colony in Hyderabad's Gachibowli by the Cyberabad Anti-Human Trafficking Unit. They detained three people and saved a woman from Uzbekistan. The main organiser of the ring, Arnav alias Abhay who is yet to be caught, posted ads on social media and dating sites targeting high profile and rich customers.

78.title: Coming: Musk to Twitter user who said 'All I want is save video button'
78.article_body: Elon Musk responded, "Coming", to a Twitter user who had tweeted, "All I want is save video button I can even pay." This comes after Musk said, "Please note that Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months. We'll keep what works & change what doesn't." Earlier, Twitter paused the 'Official' label on accounts within hours of launch.

79.title: Godrej & Boyce refutes claims of causing delay in Maha bullet train project
79.article_body: Godrej & Boyce Manufacturing refuted allegations of delaying the Ahmedabad-Mumbai bullet train project. The company told Bombay High Court that Maharashtra government's land acquisition proceedings were "illegal and bad in law". It said the final compensation amount of ₹264 crore was a fraction of the initial ₹572 crore offered to the company for the acquisition of the land in Vikhroli.

80.title: Saudi Arabia's SALIC buys 9.22% stake in LT Foods
80.article_body: Saudi Agricultural and Livestock Investment Company (SALIC), a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia, has acquired a 9.22% stake in LT Foods, which has Daawat foods under its portfolio. The deal would involve the preferential issuance of 27,408,164 shares, a 7.89% equity stake. SALIC will acquire another 1.33% stake through a secondary share purchase.

81.title: Tata Motors' stock falls by 5.5% after quarterly loss of ₹944.6 crore
81.article_body: Tata Motors' shares fell by as much as 5.5% to ₹409.3/piece on BSE on Thursday, a day after the auto major posted a net loss of ₹944.6 crore for the July-September quarter. It had posted a net loss of ₹4,441.57 crore in the corresponding period of the last financial year. The automaker's revenue increased by 29.7% to ₹79,611.3 crore year-on-year.

82.title: Samajwadi Party-Rashtriya Lok Dal to jointly contest Uttar Pradesh by-polls
82.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) and Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) have decided to jointly contest the Uttar Pradesh by-polls for Mainpuri parliamentary, Rampur and Khatauli assembly seats against the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). RLD Chief Jayant Chaudhary confirmed that SP would contest in Mainpuri and Rampur while RLD in Khatauli. The by-elections for these seats will be held on December 5.

83.title: Alia's baby is nature's blessing, we are very happy: Soni Razdan
83.article_body: Soni Razdan said that she and her family are "very happy" about the arrival of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's daughter, who was born on November 6. Calling her granddaughter as "nature's blessing", Soni shared that both Alia and her baby are doing well in terms of health. She also shared that she's been giving many motherhood tips to Alia.

84.title: Ola IPO likely next yr, mobility business doing better: CEO Bhavish
84.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has said while the company is in no urgency to go public, it could still launch an IPO next year, YourStory reported. Aggarwal said Ola's mobility business is "bigger and better than pre-COVID levels". "It was very tough for us and the ecosystem that relied on ride-sharing. The business was zero in the beginning," Aggarwal added.

85.title: Authorities detect GST evasion of ₹55,575 crore in last 2 years
85.article_body: GST authorities have detected GST fraud of ₹55,575 crore over the last two years and arrested 719 individuals in the corresponding cases. The officers of the Directorate General of GST Intelligence have reportedly detected over 22,300 fake GST identification numbers. Voluntary deposits of Goods and Services Tax (GST) worth ₹3,050 crore have been made during the period.

86.title: India crash out of T20 World Cup 2022 as England reach final for 3rd time
86.article_body: India on Thursday crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022 after losing in the semi-final to England in Adelaide. England restricted India to 168/6 in their 20 overs and chased down the target in 16 overs without losing any wicket. England have reached T20 World Cup final for the third time ever and the first time since 2016.

87.title: 'My heart sank,' says Meta employee fired during her maternity leave; shares post
87.article_body: A Meta employee, currently on maternity leave, revealed on LinkedIn that she was among the fired staff. Anneka Patel said she had woken up at 3 am to pump for her three-month daughter and was checking her email regarding layoffs. She wrote, "At 5:35 am I got the email that I had been included in the layoffs. My heart sank."

88.title: SC allows house arrest for activist Gautam Navlakha on medical grounds
88.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday allowed house arrest for activist Gautam Navlakha on medical grounds for one month. He'll not be allowed to use a computer and internet during this period. Court asked him to deposit ₹2.4 lakh for expenses in making police personnel available at the premises. Navlakha, 70, has been jailed in connection with the Elgar Parishad-Maoist link case.

89.title: KFin Technologies gets SEBI's nod to raise ₹2,400 crore through IPO
89.article_body: KFin Technologies has received capital markets regulator SEBI's approval to raise ₹2,400 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). According to the Draft Red Herring Prospectus, the IPO is entirely an Offer-For-Sale (OFS) by promoter General Atlantic Singapore Fund. All the proceeds from the offer will go to the promoter selling shareholder.

90.title: Would be historic match if India play Pakistan in T20 WC final: Inzamam
90.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam ul Haq has said that it would be a historic match if India played Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 final. He stated he wishes India to play the final match against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022 and added he'll be "happy" if that happens. Pakistan entered the final after beating New Zealand.

91.title: 13-yr-old girl kidnapped & raped in Hyderabad's Badangpet, 2 held
91.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a vehicle lifter and his friend in Hyderabad on November 5 after which the police arrested two persons. The girl said that two men reportedly forced her onto a motorcycle before raping her in two locations in Badangpet. Initially, she named two others, but later changed her version following her mother's intervention.

92.title: Iranian man who robbed people while posing as cop arrested in Mumbai
92.article_body: Mumbai Police on Thursday arrested a 55-year-old Iranian man wanted in connection with chain-snatching and cheating cases. The accused used to pose as a police officer and seize valuable items from his victims. He was an accomplice of another Iranian who posed as a crime branch officer in Mumbai, police said.

93.title: Iran says it has built hypersonic ballistic missile: Report
93.article_body: Iran has built a hypersonic ballistic missile, Tasnim news agency reported citing Revolutionary Guards' aerospace commander Amir Ali Hajizadeh. "This missile has a high speed and can manoeuvre in and out of the atmosphere. It will target the enemy's advanced anti-missile systems," Amir Ali Hajizadeh said. Hypersonic missiles can fly at least five times faster than the speed of sound.

94.title: Businessman loses nearly ₹1 crore after his phone gets hacked in Maharashtra
94.article_body: A businessman in Maharashtra's Thane lost ₹99.50 lakh after his phone was allegedly hacked, said a police official. The official said that the alleged hacking took place between November 6-7 and his funds were transferred from his bank accounts to other accounts through net banking. A case has been registered in the matter.

95.title: Couple dies by suicide over ₹1 crore debt in Gr Noida; probe launched
95.article_body: A couple died by suicide by hanging themselves in their flat in a Greater Noida society on Thursday. The couple's son was sleeping in another room when the incident took place. Meanwhile, a preliminary investigation has revealed that the couple had incurred a debt of over ₹1 crore after suffering losses in business and therefore, they took the extreme step.

96.title: Day after 22-yr-old woman stabbed to death in Pune, suspect found dead
96.article_body: A day after a 22-year-old woman was stabbed to death in Pune’s Aundh area, the suspect was found dead near a dam on Thursday, police said. The police suspect this to be a case of suicide. The 26-year-old man was allegedly harassing the woman, Shweta Ranawade, since their intended marriage broke off.

97.title: Mumbai civic body to begin redecking work on Parel TT flyover
97.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) bridges department has initiated a proposal for refurbishment of the deck portion of the Parel TT flyover. The BMC will start the work after receiving a NOC from the Mumbai Traffic Police. "The bridge won't be demolished and reconstructed, but only...work of refurbishment of the deck portion will be carried out," a BMC official said.

98.title: Don't want anybody to whine about Avatar 2's length: James Cameron
98.article_body: Director James Cameron said that he doesn't want people "whining about" the length of 'Avatar: The Way of Water' when they "sit and binge-watch" TV series for several hours. The 'Avatar' sequel is set to run for approximately three hours and 10 minutes. Cameron added that the franchise is "hideously expensive" and the sequel is "pretty much [an] insane experience".

99.title: 61-yr-old worker injured in leopard attack in Mumbai's Aarey colony
99.article_body: A 61-year-old man sustained minor injuries after being attacked by a leopard in Mumbai's Aarey Milk Colony on Sunday night. Ram Yadav, who works on a cattle farm near the forest area, was talking on his phone when the incident happened. Forest officials have installed traps to catch the animal. Last month, a leopard killed a toddler in the colony.

100.title: BMC, fire brigade send notices to Dadar school after cylinder blast
100.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and fire brigade have sent separate notices to Dadar's Chhabildas English Medium School where a cylinder blast injured three persons on November 2. "We've issued notice...because they didn't take permission from...fire brigade to use cylinders in the school premises," chief fire officer said. BMC's notice warned of filing an offence sheet in the court.

101.title: Armed men open fire at cash collection agent in Gurugram
101.article_body: Three unidentified men opened fire at a cash collection agent in a lane near Galleria Market in Gurugram's DLF Phase-4 area in an alleged robbery attempt on Wednesday, the police said. The agent was unhurt in the incident and police recovered two cartridges. According to police, the agent collects cash generated through sales from four shops in Galleria Market.

102.title: 3,000 Mumbai LLB students to receive rectified marksheets after PRN error
102.article_body: As many as 3,064 final-year LLB students of Mumbai University will receive their revised marksheets after the sheets were recalled earlier. "Every single marksheet has been corrected and will be delivered to [city] colleges by Thursday," the university's Directorate of Examinations, Dr Prasad Karande, said. The previous marksheets were carrying incorrect Permanent Registration Numbers (PRN).

103.title: Don’t pay your bills online this month: BESCOM tells B'luru residents
103.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has asked its consumers in the city to pay their bills manually this month instead of paying them online. The digital payment gateway of BESCOM developed technical glitches, following which many consumers were shown a higher amount than the original bill. BESCOM assured residents that the issue would be resolved at the earliest.

104.title: 19-year-old B.Com student killed over 'Reels rivalry' in Pune
104.article_body: A 19-year-old second-year B.Com student was murdered in the Pune district on Sunday following a purported gang war between two groups that made reels for social media, police said. A 15-year-old boy was also attacked, but he survived. Police said the deceased and the 15-year-old boy were a part of the "Sarkar Group", while the attackers were from "Baba Group".

105.title: Prepare for difficult times ahead: Musk in his first email to Twitter employees
105.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk in his first email to Twitter employees asked them to prepare for "difficult times ahead". Musk said there was "no way to sugarcoat the message" about the economic outlook and how it'll affect Twitter. In another email, he said, "Over the next few days, the absolute top priority is finding and suspending any verified bots/trolls/spam."

106.title: FTX CEO appealed for cash injection amid $7-billion liability: OKX exec
106.article_body: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried appealed for a $2 billion to $4 billion cash injection from OKX on Monday, OKX's Managing Director of Financial Markets Lennix Lai said. Bankman-Fried made the appeal for cash injection just before the now-collapsed acquisition mooted by Binance was announced. FTX was facing a $7-billion total liability, Lai said citing Bankman-Fried's comment made in the call.

107.title: Remote work banned, be in office at least 40 hrs/week: Musk's 1st email to Twitter staff
107.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk emailed Twitter's employees for the first time late Wednesday, where he banned remote work unless he personally approved it, reported Bloomberg. He asked employees to be in the office for at least 40 hours per week. He also asked the employees to prepare for "difficult times ahead".

108.title: Hardik Pandya becomes first Indian to get out hit wicket in World Cup history
108.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has become the first Indian cricketer to get out hit wicket in a World Cup (T20I or ODI) match. The 29-year-old got out hit wicket on last delivery of India's innings in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England. Pandya hit four on the delivery, however, it didn't count as he hit stumps with his leg.

109.title: Potholes & bad roads, say residents to PM Modi ahead of B'luru visit
109.article_body: Several residents took to social media to address the issue of potholes and bad roads ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Bengaluru. Dear PM Modi, if you find the ride smooth while in Bengaluru, not bumpy, please don't believe it, tweeted one of the residents, adding that roads are being "spruced up" by BBMP for PM's visit.

110.title: 14 police stations in Bengaluru to have libraries for public
110.article_body: As many as 14 police stations in Bengaluru will have libraries as part of a programme to improve community outreach. Till now, these libraries have been set up in four stations which are - Koramangala, Mico Layout, Hulimavu and Electronic City. The libraries are accessible to anyone who walks into the police station and waits to be attended to.

111.title: India are 10 short but do have a chance vs Eng due to Hardik's 63: Harsha
111.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle said Hardik Pandya's 63 off 33 balls that helped India post a total of 168 in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, has given India a "definite chance". "[Hardik is a] serious player...[The] ball is turning a bit too. [India are] probably 10 runs short," added Harsha. Hardik's 63 comprised four fours and five sixes.

112.title: People started saying certain things after Virat Kohli didn't score: Hardik
112.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, speaking about India batter Virat Kohli, has said that people started saying "certain things" about Kohli after he didn't score for a "couple of months". "But somewhere...we all knew the cricketer he is," Hardik stated. Kohli has been the highest scorer in the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022 with 296 runs in six innings.

113.title: Sweden & Finland are allies, they can count on us: Hungary on NATO bid
113.article_body: Hungarian Prime Minister's Chief of Staff Gergely Gulyas has said that the country's parliament will discuss ratification of Finland and Sweden's NATO bids during its autumn session, mentioning that the two countries are "allies and they can count on us". Hungary and Turkey are the only two NATO members who haven't cleared the Nordic nations' bid to join the alliance.

114.title: Jacqueline might flee India, not cooperating in investigation: ED
114.article_body: Opposing Jacqueline Fernandez's bail petition in Patiala court, the Enforcement Directorate said that if she is given bail, she might attempt to flee the country. The ED also alleged that she is not cooperating in the investigation and accused her of tampering with evidence. Jacqueline is one of the accused in the ₹200 crore extortion case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar.

115.title: Lalu's daughter Roshni to donate him kidney, RJD chief to visit Singapore: Report
115.article_body: Ailing RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's Singapore-based daughter Roshni Acharya will donate a kidney to her father, PTI reported citing a close family member. The 74-year-old Bihar leader returned last month from Singapore where he had gone for treatment for his kidney problems. According to reports, Yadav is likely to visit Singapore in November for the kidney transplant.

116.title: Man named Salman Khan performs 42 backflips at Mumbai beach; video viral
116.article_body: A video of a man performing 42 backflips in one go at Mumbai's Juhu beach has gone viral online. The man, named 'Salman Khan', posted the video of his gymnastics skills on Instagram and wrote, "How many flips? Next time with more power." A netizen commented, "Next level Mumbai Ka Tarzan." Another said, "You can break the world record."

117.title: Virat Kohli becomes first cricketer in history to score 4,000 runs in T20I cricket
117.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has become the first cricketer in history to score 4,000 runs in T20I cricket. Kohli reached the milestone during his 40-ball 50-run knock in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England in Adelaide on Thursday. Kohli has now hit 38 50-plus scores in 107 innings in T20I cricket.

118.title: Indian man relocates to Canada for job at Meta, fired 2 days after joining
118.article_body: A man who relocated from India to Canada for a job at Meta was fired two days after his joining. Sharing a post on LinkedIn about the same, IIT-Kharagpur graduate Himanshu V wrote, "What's next for me? Honestly, I have no idea! I'm looking forward to whatever comes next." On Wednesday, Meta Platforms fired over 11,000 of its employees worldwide.

119.title: I find this extremely pointless: Jet Airways CEO on Twitter's 'Official' label
119.article_body: After Twitter launched the "official" verification label before taking it down abruptly, Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said, he finds it "extremely pointless". "I am one of those who finds this extremely pointless. Why not just have a $ sign or something for paid subscribers, and retain the blue tick for verified accounts? It is not rocket science," Kapoor tweeted.

120.title: My arrest was political, didn't see such political vendetta earlier: Raut
120.article_body: A day after his release from Mumbai’s Arthur Road jail in a money laundering case, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said his arrest was "political". "The country has never seen this kind of politics. Our country was under foreign rule for 150 years but we did not see this kind of political vendetta in the country," Raut added.

121.title: Sharad Pawar not to join Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra: Jairam
121.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday said that NCP chief Sharad Pawar won’t be joining the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Friday due to health issues. "He was recently hospitalised, Rahul Gandhi and I talked to him. The doctor has recommended a three to four-week rest," Ramesh added. Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray will join the yatra tomorrow, Ramesh stated.

122.title: Satyendar Jain should be shifted to UP or H’yana jail from Tihar: BJP MP
122.article_body: BJP MP Parvesh Verma demanded that Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain should be shifted from the Tihar Jail. "He should be shifted to some other jail in Haryana or UP because Jain has made Tihar a den of corruption," Verma said. Jain is in jail in connection with a money laundering case against him.

123.title: Why haven't you arrested Jacqueline yet, why pick-and-choose: Delhi court to ED
123.article_body: Hearing bail application of Jacqueline Fernandez in a ₹200 crore money laundering case, a Delhi judge on Thursday warned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) not to implement a "pick-and-choose policy". "Why haven't you arrested Jacqueline yet despite issuing an LOC? Other accused are in jail," court told ED. The court is likely to announce its decision tomorrow on Jacqueline's bail request.

124.title: Apple restricts 'Everyone' option in AirDrop to 10 minutes in China
124.article_body: Apple has restricted the "Everyone" option in the AirDrop file-sharing feature to ten minutes in iOS 16.1.1 update on iPhones purchased in China. While Apple didn’t comment on why this was done in China, it's said that protesters in the country used the service to spread posters opposing Xi Jinping and the Chinese government.

125.title: 3 cattle smugglers injured after being chased by gau rakshaks in Gurugram
125.article_body: Three suspected cattle smugglers suffered injuries after their pick-up truck overturned while being chased by gau rakshaks in Gurugram on Thursday, police said. In a purported video of the incident, the accused were allegedly seen throwing cows on the road to escape, said Mohit Yadav, a member of the Haryana government's cow protection task force.

126.title: Duo kidnaps businessman's son in Ghaziabad, demands ₹20 lakh ransom
126.article_body: Two men kidnapped the three-year-old son of a real-estate businessman from outside his house in Ghaziabad on Tuesday. Later, they called up the child's family, demanding a ransom of ₹20 lakh for his release. However, police through electronic surveillance tracked the suspects and nabbed them when they came to take the ransom. Police handed over the boy to his family.

127.title: Qatar unveils 6,000 cabin World Cup fan village in desert
127.article_body: Qatar on Wednesday unveiled a 6,000-cabin fan village in an isolated lot near its airports. The area could hold as many as 12,000 people if booked at capacity, officials said. Around 60% of the cabins are already booked for the tournament, said Omar al-Jaber, the head of accommodation at Qatar's Supreme Committee for Delivery and Legacy for the tournament.

128.title: Akshay Kumar to have a cameo in Ayushmann's 'An Action Hero': Report
128.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar will reportedly have a cameo appearance in Ayushmann Khurrana's upcoming film 'An Action Hero'. "Akshay has already shot for an important appearance in the film, which brings about a change in Ayushmann's character and perspective," a source told Bollywood Hungama. The Anirudh Iyer directorial will release on December 2, 2022.

129.title: ED dancing to tune of PM Modi, Shah: Congress on Sanjay Raut case
129.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that the PMLA (Prevention of Money Laundering Act) court made scathing observations on the behaviour of ED in the Sanjay Raut case. "Now, there is ample evidence to show that the ED is not a professional agency and dances to the tune of the Prime Minister and Home Minister," he said.

130.title: Mumbai Police ban flying of drones, other objects in city till December 12
130.article_body: Mumbai Police on Thursday banned the flying of drones and other devices in the city from November 13 to December 12. "No flying activities of drones, remote-controlled micro-light aircraft, para-gliders, para motors, hang gliders, hot air balloons, private helicopters, etc. shall be allowed," the order stated. With this, Mumbai Police aim to maintain law and order situation in the city.

131.title: Dislocated shoulder twice: Janhvi on 'Mr & Mrs Mahi' prep
131.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor shared that she dislocated her shoulder twice while playing cricket as a part of her preparation for 'Mr & Mrs Mahi'. The film, which will also feature Rajkummar Rao, is directed by Sharan Sharma and will star Janhvi as a cricketer. Apart from 'Mr & Mrs Mahi', Janhvi will also be seen in Nitesh Tiwari's 'Bawaal'.

132.title: BJP fields ex-MLA who jumped into river to save lives after bridge collapse in Morbi
132.article_body: BJP has fielded Kantilal Amrutiya, a former MLA from Morbi, who reportedly saved lives after the Morbi bridge collapse tragedy by jumping into the river, for the upcoming Gujarat polls. Amrutiya had won the Morbi Assembly seat in 1995, 1998, 2002, 2007 and 2012. Amrutiya has replaced Brijesh Merja, the current MLA of Morbi, as BJP's candidate from Morbi.

133.title: Around 6,000 police personnel to be deployed for PM Modi's protection in B'luru
133.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will arrive in Bengaluru tomorrow to take part in multiple events, including a public rally, and around 6,000 police personnel will be deployed for his security arrangement, the police said. PM Modi will arrive in Bengaluru's HAL airport at 9 am and will leave for Madurai Airport in Tamil Nadu at 1.45 pm, as per reports.

134.title: Sequoia Capital marks down its entire $214-million investment in FTX to $0
134.article_body: Venture capital firm Sequoia Capital said that it's marking down the full value of its investment in FTX to zero dollars amid uncertainty over the crypto exchange's liquidity crunch. The VC firm put in $213.5 million last year in FTX’s international and US businesses. Sequoia added, "The full nature and extent of this risk isn't known at this time."

135.title: Female patient beaten by drunk doctor at hospital in Chhattisgarh
135.article_body: A female patient was beaten by a doctor, who was allegedly drunk, at a hospital in Chhattisgarh's Korba district. The hospital management has issued a show-cause notice against the doctor after a video of the incident went viral on social media. The woman's son said that when he protested against the act, he was told to keep quiet.

136.title: Noida executive wanted in rape case hits guard with SUV while escaping police, video out
136.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a man running over a security guard with his SUV at the gate of a housing society in Noida to escape from police. The driver, Neeraj Singh, works as general manager at a private company and is wanted in a rape case filed by a former co-worker. The guard was injured in the incident.

137.title: Rachakonda SHE Teams arrest 125 persons for harassing women
137.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police arrested 125 persons for harassing women at various places across the Commissionerate in the last six weeks. As many as 91 cases were booked, including 28 FIRs, during this period. Officials informed that those caught were mandated to attend counselling sessions conducted by trained counsellors and psychologists.

138.title: Sensex falls over 500 points, Nifty below 18,000 amid weak global cues
138.article_body: The Sensex was trading 589.68 points down at 60,443.87 in Thursday's intra-day trade amid weak global cues. The Nifty fell by 179.90 points to 17,977.10. With Nifty Auto and PSU Bank indices down 2% each, all sectoral indices were in the red. About 1,012 shares have advanced, 2,138 shares declined and 114 shares remained unchanged.

139.title: BJP names 160 candidates for Gujarat polls, CM Bhupendra Patel to contest from Ghatlodia
139.article_body: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 160 candidates for the two-phase elections to the 182-member Gujarat Assembly, fielding Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel from Ghatlodia. BJP leader Kantilal Shivlal Amrutiya got the party ticket from Morbi, which recently saw a bridge collapse killing 135 people, while Hardik Patel will contest from Viramgam seat.

140.title: Disney's stock falls by 13% after Q4 results, worst 1-day drop in 21 yrs
140.article_body: After Walt Disney Company's direct-to-consumer arm's losses more than doubled to $1.47 billion in the fourth quarter, its stock suffered the worst one-day fall in 21 years, on Wednesday. The company's stock closed over 13% down at $86.75/share. This is the biggest one-day loss since September 17, 2001, when trading resumed after the 9/11 terrorist attacks in 2001.

141.title: Deepika's role in 'Pathaan' justifies her superstardom: Siddharth
141.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand shared that Deepika Padukone's role in 'Pathaan' is "breathtaking" and "justifies her superstardom". He promised that the film will show her in her "hottest and coolest" avatar. Talking about Deepika's pairing with Shah Rukh Khan, Siddharth said, "They've electric chemistry with each other and they look just so hot together...their jodi is a huge USP for 'Pathaan'."

142.title: Russian President Putin will not attend G20 summit in Bali: Indonesia
142.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will not attend the G20 summit in Indonesia next week, an Indonesian government official confirmed. Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, Chief of Support for G20 events, said that Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will lead the Russian delegation. US President Joe Biden, Chinese President Xi Jinping and other world leaders will attend the two-day summit in Bali.

143.title: Fadnavis has taken some good decisions, state being run by him: Raut
143.article_body: A day after being released from jail, Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that he welcomed some good decisions taken by the newly formed Maharashtra government. "Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis took some good decisions. We feel that the state is being run by him and he is leading the state," Raut added.

144.title: Akhilesh's wife Dimple Yadav to contest from Mainpuri after Mulayam's death
144.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav will contest from Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri seat which has been left vacant following the demise of Mulayam Singh Yadav on October 10. The Election Commission had announced last week that bypolls for the Lok Sabha constituency will be held on December 5. Dimple has served as a Lok Sabha MP twice.

145.title: Musk's relationships with other countries 'worthy of being looked at': Biden
145.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said he thinks Twitter boss Elon Musk's relationships with other countries are "worthy of being looked at". Biden was asked if Musk's acquisition of Twitter with help from a Saudi conglomerate should be investigated by US. "Whether he is doing anything inappropriate, I'm not suggesting that," Biden further said.

146.title: I'm not dead: Britney Spears on people wanting to do her biopic
146.article_body: After Millie Bobby Brown expressed her wish to play Britney Spears in a film, the singer took to Instagram and reacted indirectly to the statement. "I hear about people wanting to do movies about my life. Dude, I'm not dead," she said. Millie, on Drew Barrymore's talk show, said she feels she can tell Britney's story in the right way.

147.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England
147.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final match. India are fielding the same playing XI that played against Zimbabwe in their last Super 12 stage match. England have made two changes, with Phil Salt and Chris Jordan replacing Dawid Malan and Mark Wood.

148.title: Noida authority to organise e-bidding of 2 group housing plots
148.article_body: The Noida authority said that it is likely to organise an e-bidding of two group housing plots on sale in a scheme on November 11. These two plots are located in Sector 146 and 151 along the Noida Expressway. The plot sizes for group housing projects range between 18,960 square metres and 94,202 square metres, according to officials.

149.title: India featuring in a World Cup knockout match without MS Dhoni for first time in 19 years
149.article_body: India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final is India's first knockout match in an ICC World Cup (both ODI and T20I) without MS Dhoni in 19 years. The last time India played a white-ball knockout match without Dhoni in ICC tournament was 2003 World Cup final. Dhoni featured in India's all previous 11 knockout matches in World Cups, captaining in 10.

150.title: No one allowed to disturb peace: Punjab CM on Bargari sacrilege accused's killing
150.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said no one will be allowed to disturb the peace of the state after Bargari sacrilege incident accused and Dera Sacha Sauda follower Pardeep Singh was shot dead in Faridkot district. "Strict instructions to the civil and police officials to maintain the peace and tranquillity of the state," CM Mann tweeted.

151.title: Malaika Arora's 'I said yes' post sparks rumours of engagement with Arjun Kapoor
151.article_body: Malaika Arora sparked rumours of engagement with Arjun Kapoor as she took to Instagram to share a picture of herself, and wrote "I said YES." Several celebrities took to the comments section to wish Malaika and Arjun all the best. "Woah woah woah!!" wrote actor Karan Tacker, while stylist Tanya Ghavri commented, "Oh my god."

152.title: Twitter pauses 'Official' tag on accounts, says 'we are going after impersonation'
152.article_body: Twitter Support account on Thursday tweeted, "We're not currently putting an "Official" label on accounts but we are aggressively going after impersonation and deception." Earlier, Elon Musk tweeted that he "killed" the new 'Official' label for Twitter accounts, on the same day that it began rolling out. He also said, "Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months."

153.title: Suryakumar can be dismissed by forcing him to hit over mid-on: Malik
153.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik said Suryakumar Yadav can be dismissed by being forced to play shots over mid-on. "You should bring the mid-on player closer and make the mid-off fielder move further," added Malik. Sharing his opinion on the manner in which Suryakumar can be dismissed, ex-Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said, "[One should] ensure that he doesn't have much width."

154.title: Was 17-18, started shaking when I walked on set: Priyanka on her 1st film
154.article_body: Sharing her experience of shooting for her Bollywood debut 'The Hero', actress Priyanka Chopra said, "I was 17 or 18...When I walked on the set with Sunny Deol, I was shaking...It wasn't my reality." "I didn't know what was thrust upon me," added Priyanka. "I...watched movies but I didn't think I could ever be in them," she stated.

155.title: Bargari sacrilege accused shot dead by 5 gunmen in Punjab, video surfaces
155.article_body: Bargari sacrilege incident accused and Dera Sacha Sauda follower Pardeep Singh was shot dead by five gunmen in Punjab's Faridkot district on Thursday. Police said Singh's security personnel also fired in retaliation and three people were injured in the incident. Key accused in Sidhu Moosewala's murder, gangster Goldy Brar, has taken the responsibility of killing Pardeep Singh on social media.

156.title: Mumbai-based startup QubeHealth raises pre-Series A funding
156.article_body: Healthcare-focused fintech company QubeHealth﻿ raised an undisclosed pre-Series A round led by the US-based New Horizon Ventures, ThinKuvate (Singapore) and Keiretsu Forum, an existing investor. The funding round saw the participation of Axiomatic Ventures, Inflection Point Ventures and angel investors from India and the US. Founded in 2019, QubeHealth is headquartered in Mumbai.

157.title: Expect Putin to talk seriously about prisoner swap for Griner: Joe Biden
157.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said he expected Russian President Vladimir Putin to be willing to talk more seriously with Washington about prisoner swap for US basketball player Brittney Griner's release. "My intention is to get her home," Biden added. Griner was arrested at Moscow airport when vape cartridges containing cannabis oil, banned in Russia, were found in her luggage.

158.title: Vivek Agnihotri announces 'The Vaccine War', to release in 11 languages
158.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri announced his next film, titled 'The Vaccine War'. The filmmaker said the story represents a "true story of war that...India fought and won with its science, courage and great Indian values". The film will release in 11 languages, including Bangla, Gujarati, Marathi and Bhojpuri. It will be produced by Pallavi Joshi and Abhishek Agarwal.

159.title: India reports 1,016 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 13,187
159.article_body: India reported 1,016 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 811 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases in India stands at 13,187. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,514, according to the ministry.

160.title: AAP gives ads worth ₹5,000 for ₹5 work: BJP's Tejasvi Surya
160.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and said that Arvind Kejriwal's party spends ₹5,000 on publicity for doing work worth just ₹5. "You need to stay wary of such people. They are not only ruining their own lives, but also ruining the country," said Surya during an interaction with the first-time voters of Gujarat.

161.title: US-based startup Equals raises $16 million in Series A funding round
161.article_body: US-based spreadsheet platform Equals has secured $16 million in Series A funding round led by Andreessen Horowitz. The funding round saw participation from Craft Ventures and BoxGroup. In July, the startup had raised $6.6 million in a seed round led by David Sacks of Craft Ventures. The platform was co-founded by Ben McRedmond and Bobby Pinero.

162.title: Draft electoral rolls of constituencies in Hyderabad published
162.article_body: The electoral registration officers on Wednesday published the draft electoral rolls of Hyderabad's 15 assembly constituencies. "Voters can verify their names and submit their claims and objections, if any, to the concerned electoral registration officers from November 9 to December 8," a senior GHMC official said. Voters can verify their names online by visiting the CEO Telangana's website.

163.title: 9 Indians killed in fire in Maldives
163.article_body: Nine Indians have been killed in a fire in Maldives' capital Male, according to reports. At least ten people have been killed in the fire that broke out in a building, officials said. The disaster management agency said an evacuation centre has been setup and arrangements are being made to provide relief assistance and support.

164.title: No team has ever won a T20I after winning toss at India's T20 WC 2022 semi-final venue
164.article_body: India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final will take place at Adelaide Oval. A total of 11 T20Is have taken place at the venue so far. No team has ever won a T20I at Adelaide Oval after winning the toss. Further, team batting first has won seven T20Is at Adelaide Oval, while team batting second has won four.

165.title: Snoop Dogg announces his biopic, says 'waited for a long time'
165.article_body: Universal Pictures on Wednesday announced Snoop Dogg's biopic, which will be produced by the rapper himself. Snoop Dogg said he waited for a long time to put his biopic together as he wanted "to choose the right director, the perfect writer and the greatest movie company" that could understand his legacy. The biopic will be directed by Allen Hughes.

166.title: Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba to contest Gujarat Assembly elections on BJP ticket
166.article_body: Cricketer Ravindrasinh Jadeja's wife Rivaba Jadeja will contest Gujarat Assembly elections from Jamnagar North constituency on BJP ticket, the party announced on Thursday. Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel will contest from Ghatlodia, while Hardik Patel is being fielded from the Viramgam constituency. BJP announced the names of candidates from 160 constituencies today.

167.title: Tesla stock hits 2-year low after Musk sells shares worth $3.95 bn
167.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk disclosed that he sold 19.5 million Tesla shares worth $3.95 billion, its shares fell to their lowest level since November 23, 2020. Tesla's shares ended 7.2% lower at $177.59 on Wednesday. With this sale, total value of Tesla shares sold by Musk since he disclosed his stake in Twitter in April, reached nearly $20 billion.

168.title: I intend to run for President again, ultimately a family decision: Joe Biden
168.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that he intends to run for President again. Biden said "this is ultimately a family decision", adding that his family wanted him to run and he did not feel rushed to make a final decision. Biden also said his decision would be unrelated to any announcement by former US President Donald Trump.

169.title: A few NZ players score more runs on Twitter than on the field: Gavaskar
169.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's defeat against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, Sunil Gavaskar said, "They'll have to take tough calls. There are players who haven't...[scored] runs, yet they've cemented their places." "There are a few New Zealand players who have a big following on Twitter. They score more runs on Twitter than on the field," added Gavaskar.

170.title: Djokovic is my greatest rival as well as my most dangerous rival: Nadal
170.article_body: Rafael Nadal said Novak Djokovic is his "greatest" rival as well as his "most dangerous" rival currently. "After all, Djokovic's...[the] closest to the number of Grand Slams [I've won]," added Nadal. Djokovic had earlier termed Nadal as his "greatest rival" of all time. The two players will face off in the upcoming edition of the ATP Finals.

171.title: I've spent over 100 days in jail, what was my crime?: Sanjay Raut
171.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut walked out of Mumbai’s Arthur Road jail after the court granted him bail in a money-laundering case and said, "I don’t hold grudges against anybody." He added, "I've spent over 100 days in jail, what was my crime? There can be a difference of opinion in a democracy." "We didn't do anything wrong," Raut stated.

172.title: BJP bagging huge money through electoral bonds ahead of polls: Mamata
172.article_body: The BJP is bagging crores of rupees through electoral bonds ahead of the Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh elections, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee alleged. "Every party takes bonds because they are legal. But the BJP collects crores whenever an election comes," the West Bengal CM added. On Monday, Centre approved the issuance of the 23rd tranche of electoral bonds.

173.title: This was ultimately my call: Zuckerberg in leaked video to fired staff after layoffs
173.article_body: After firing over 11,000 employees, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg addressed the affected staff virtually, a video of which was allegedly leaked by an impacted employee. Calling it one of the "hardest calls" while running the firm for 18 years, Zuckerberg said, "I'm the founder and CEO, I'm responsible for the health of our company…and this was ultimately my call."

174.title: See this happens in Parliament, says Rahul Gandhi and turns off his mic
174.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday, while addressing a meeting in Maharashtra’s Nanded, switched off his microphone, saying "And see what happens with us in Parliament." He added, "We started this Bharat Jodo Yatra because media may not be in a position to highlight us." He stated, "In Parliament, if you raise issues like China...your mic is switched off."

175.title: Ranbir Kapoor holds daughter in arms as they reach home from hospital, pic surfaces
