175.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, along with their newborn baby girl, reached their home Vastu on Thursday morning. In the photos that have surfaced on social media, Ranbir is seen holding his daughter in his arms as Alia sits next to him in the car. They had welcomed their first child at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital on Sunday.

176.title: You put your heart & soul in this place: Zuckerberg in leaked video call to fired staff
176.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg addressed the fired employees virtually after layoffs, a video of which was allegedly leaked by an impacted employee. In the video, Zuckerberg said, "You've...put your heart and soul into this place…I want to say up front that I take full responsibility for this...I’m the founder and CEO. I’m responsible for the health of our company."

177.title: Over 100,000 Russian troops killed, wounded in Ukraine: Top US general
177.article_body: US Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff General Mark Milley has said that over 100,000 Russian soldiers have been killed and wounded in Ukraine. While speaking at The Economic Club of New York, Milley said Kyiv’s military “probably” suffered a similar level of casualties. “When there’s an opportunity to negotiate, when peace can be achieved...seize the moment,” Milley added.

178.title: Having no viable embryos was devastating: Rebel Wilson
178.article_body: Actress Rebel Wilson, who recently welcomed a baby girl via surrogacy, said it was "devastating" to know that she had "no viable embryos". She said that her "desire to become a mother" was "so strong" that she "needed to keep trying". Rebel added that holding her "gorgeous and perfect" daughter for the first time was "overwhelming and exciting".

179.title: EU's antitrust regulators may charge Meta over classified ads: Reports
179.article_body: European Union's (EU) antitrust regulators are reportedly preparing a list of charges against Facebook parent Meta over customer data usage and the tying of its marketplace platform to its social network. Meta's classified ads business is called Facebook Marketplace. The European Commission can impose fines of up to 10% of a company's global turnover for antitrust violations.

180.title: India, we have reached, are you ready: Shoaib Akhtar ahead of India's T20 WC semi-final
180.article_body: Ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against England, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar, referring to Pakistan reaching the final, said, "India, we have reached. Are you ready?" He added, "It's the MCG and the 1992 World Cup-winning moment might be recreated again. I really want India to come to the final and play against Pakistan."

181.title: Who are the highest run-scorers and wicket-takers in India-England T20Is?
181.article_body: India's Virat Kohli has smashed the most runs in India-England T20Is, with 589 runs in 19 innings. He's followed by England captain Jos Buttler (395 runs in 17 innings) and India captain Rohit Sharma (383 runs in 13 innings). England pacer Chris Jordan has taken most wickets in India-England T20Is with 18 scalps. He's followed by Yuzvendra Chahal (16 wickets).

182.title: Indian social media users manipulating digital information: Experts at Europe meet
182.article_body: European parliamentarians and experts have cautioned against the capacity of social media users in India to manipulate the digital information environment for political and ideological propaganda. The online session, entitled 'Taking Stock of India's Information Manipulation Ecosystem', was attended by members of European Parliament, European Commission and experts at UK's Home Office.

183.title: India didn't need to bring in Pant, Karthik only got 1 chance: Kumble
183.article_body: Former India captain Anil Kumble said India didn't need to bring Rishabh Pant into their lineup for the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Zimbabwe. "It was not like Dinesh Karthik got chances and did not score. He only got a chance in one game," added Kumble. "Now since Pant has been introduced, he should continue playing," he stated.

184.title: UK PM Sunak's close ally resigns over abusive texts; told official to 'slit throat'
184.article_body: UK minister Gavin Williamson, a close ally of PM Rishi Sunak, resigned from the Cabinet on Wednesday. Williamson had been accused of acting in a bullying manner, sending expletive-laden messages and telling one government official to "slit your throat". "I obviously regret appointing someone who has had to resign in these circumstances," Sunak said.

185.title: Why are they not going to Amethi?: BJP leader on Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra
185.article_body: BJP leader Sudhanshu Trivedi on Wednesday asked what the "fear" was due to which Congress leader Rahul Gandhi did not visit Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat for the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Why are they not going to Sardar Patel's place or Subhas Chandra Bose's place? Why are they not going to Amethi or Raebareli?" Trivedi asked.

186.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of routes to avoid for PM Modi's visit tomorrow
186.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police department has shared a list of routes where vehicular movement will be prohibited on Friday from 8 am to 2 pm during PM Narendra Modi's visit to the city. Some of the routes where vehicular traffic will be prohibited are - CTO Junction, Raj Bhavan Road, Basaveshwara Circle and roads near Kempegowda International Airport (KIA).

187.title: I don't think anyone can stop Pak from winning T20 WC 2022: Inzamam
187.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said no one can stop Pakistan from winning T20 World Cup 2022, following their triumph in the semi-final against New Zealand. "Pakistan look unstoppable," added Inzamam. "[A] lot of people are comparing this to 1992. Pakistan beat New Zealand that time as well in the semi-final. They faced England in the final...That could happen again," he stated.

188.title: Use Twitter to see how things are evolving: Musk to brands as they halt ads
188.article_body: Addressing brands who have pulled advertisements off Twitter, the social media company's new owner Elon Musk said, "I understand if people want to give it a minute." "The best way to see how things are evolving is just use Twitter," he added. Several brands, including General Motors, General Mills, Audi and Pfizer have paused ads on Twitter following Musk's takeover.

189.title: Stray dog bites kid, woman in Ghaziabad society, residents stage protest
189.article_body: Residents of Ghaziabad's Panchsheel Wellington society in Crossings Republik staged a protest after two incidents of stray dog attacks were reported in the past few days. The dog bit a kid on Tuesday and had earlier bitten a woman, according to reports. The residents banned all movements inside the society gate, including that of delivery boys, during the protest.

190.title: Aurobindo Pharma's Sharath Reddy, businessman Vinoy Babu held in Delhi liquor policy case
190.article_body: The ED has arrested two businessmen from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in connection with the Delhi liquor policy case, News18 reported. Sharath Reddy, the Director of Aurobindo Pharma and Vinoy Babu, who holds key responsibilities in Pernod Ricard, a liquor company, were reportedly arrested for money laundering. Earlier, the ED arrested Delhi liquor businessman Sameer Mahandru in the case.

191.title: Shehnaaz launches chat show 'Desi Vibes...', hosts Rajkummar as guest
191.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill shared the first glimpse of her chat show, 'Desi Vibes with Shehnaaz Gill'. She revealed that she would be hosting Rajkummar Rao as guest on the show. "Dreams do come true, and today, was one such moment...I always wanted to work with the very talented actor Rajkummar Rao...I am on the moon literally," she wrote on Instagram.

192.title: If we don't try bold moves, how will we improve: Musk on changes at Twitter
192.article_body: As several advertisers paused ads on Twitter amid the recent changes at the company, Elon Musk remarked, "If we don't try bold moves, how will we make great improvements?" Musk added, "When we make a dumb move we correct it quickly that is what really matters." Earlier, Musk tweeted that "Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months."

193.title: What is India's record against England in T20I cricket?
193.article_body: India and England have played 22 T20Is against each other, with India winning 12 times and losing 10 times. India have won four of their last five T20Is against England. India's highest T20I total against England is 224/2, which they registered in March 2021. Virat Kohli has scored 589 runs in T20Is against England, the most by an India batter.

194.title: Committee to be set up to ease process of enlisting transgenders as voters: CEC
194.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar said a committee will be set up to make the entire process of enlisting transgenders as voters easier. "They are saying they have no property rights...what address they should give? They said they have stigmas, their date of birth isn't logged," Kumar said. "We'd also try to make some transgenders our national icons," he stated.

195.title: How has Kohli performed in Adelaide where India will play their T20 WC semi-final today?
195.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli has scored 907 runs in 14 innings at an average of 75.58 at Adelaide Oval, where India will face England in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final today. In T20Is, he has amassed 154 runs at a strike rate of 155.55 in two innings at the ground. "I absolutely love playing in this ground," Kohli earlier said.

196.title: Defending champions France name 25-member squad for 2022 FIFA World Cup
196.article_body: Defending champions France have named 25-member squad for the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup, which is scheduled to begin on November 20 in Qatar. France has named three goalkeepers, nine defenders, six midfielders and seven strikers. Ballon d'Or 2022 winner Karim Benzema, Olivier Giroud and Raphael Varane have been included. Notably, France's squad includes 11 World Cup winners.

197.title: NZ should think beyond him in T20s: Harbhajan on Williamson's 46(42) vs Pak
197.article_body: Harbhajan Singh said New Zealand should look "beyond" Kane Williamson in T20s, adding that Williamson isn't a top-class player in the format. Williamson scored 46(42) in New Zealand's T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final against Pakistan. "Williamson...[was] playing run-a-ball...New Zealand should've scored more...The batters were not looking to hit fours...You've to take...chances," added Harbhajan.

198.title: Fintech startup Monsoon CreditTech raises funds led by HDFC Capital
198.article_body: Fintech startup Monsoon CreditTech announced on Wednesday that it has raised an undisclosed amount in a funding round led by HDFC Capital. Several existing and new investors, including The Sparkle Fund by DMI Alternative Investment Fund, TopShelf Equity Partners and angel investors such as Vellayan Subbiah and Akash Bhanshali of the Enam Group also participated in the funding round.

199.title: FTX going down is not good for anyone in industry: Binance CEO in email to staff
199.article_body: After cancelling its acquisition of rival FTX, Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao sent an email to his staff, which he also made public. Zhao wrote, “We didn't master plan this or anything related to it.” He added that FTX going down "is not good for anyone in the industry" and that employees should not "view it as a win for us".

200.title: Centre sends high-level team to Mumbai amid measles outbreak in slums
200.article_body: After the outbreak of measles in slum areas of Mumbai, the Union Health Ministry has deputed a high-level multi-disciplinary team in the city to check the upsurge of cases. The team will assist the state health authorities in instituting public health measures and facilitate the operationalisation of requisite control and containment measures, the Ministry said.

201.title: 3 dead, 17 injured in bus collision on Jammu-Pathankot highway
201.article_body: Three people, including a 13-year-old girl, were killed with 17 injured following a bus collision on Jammu-Pathankot highway in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. At least seven victims suffered multiple injuries, said Dr Bharat Bhushan, the medical officer of Samba District Hospital. "Extremely pained by the loss of lives," read a tweet from Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha.

202.title: What reasons did Binance cite to back out of deal to acquire FTX?
202.article_body: Backing out of acquiring FTX, Binance said "a result of corporate due diligence" as well as news reports regarding mishandled customer funds and alleged US agency investigations led to this decision. It added, "In the beginning, our hope was to be able to support FTX’s customers to provide liquidity, but the issues are beyond our control or ability to help."

203.title: Jennifer Aniston says narratives on breakup with Brad were 'absolute lies'
203.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston, in a recent interview, opened up about her split from husband Brad Pitt and spending years trying to have a baby through IVF. The actress said that the narratives that she "just cared about career...wouldn't give him (Brad) a kid", were "absolute lies". About her IVF struggles, Jennifer said she wanted the world to know her truth.

204.title: Citigroup to sell Nykaa shares worth ₹250 cr via block deal: Report
204.article_body: Citigroup has reportedly launched a deal to sell shares worth ₹250 crore in beauty e-commerce retailer Nykaa via a block deal involving "individual employee seller". The deal also offers a discount of up to 2% on the current market price. The lock-in period for the shares of Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Limited will expire on Thursday.

205.title: GHMC's draft budget for ₹6,224 crore approved by standing committee
205.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's (GHMC) standing committee gave its approval for the draft budget of ₹6,224 crore submitted by officials for the year 2023-24 at a meeting held on Wednesday. The standing committee also gave its nod to the revised budget for the current financial year (2022-23) which was increased from ₹6,150 crore to ₹6,475 crore.

206.title: Operational readiness of Army should always be at peak level: Rajnath Singh
206.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Wednesday called on top Army commanders to always maintain the force’s operational readiness at its peak level. "I have full faith and confidence in the Indian Army and its leadership," Singh said during an interaction with the commanders at their ongoing biannual conference. In a tweet, Singh described his interaction with the commanders as “productive”.

207.title: What did Mumbai court say while granting bail to Sanjay Raut in money laundering case?
207.article_body: A special court in Mumbai on Wednesday granted bail to Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut in a money laundering case, calling his arrest illegal and a "witch-hunt." The court said that Raut was arrested "for no reason" by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). The court added that the main accused were never arrested, which shows the "pick-and-choose attitude" of the ED.

208.title: Working as quickly as I can on next steps: FTX CEO to staff after Binance cancels deal
208.article_body: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried told employees that he was exploring all options for his company after Binance cancelled plans of acquiring it. In a message to staff, Sam wrote, "I'm working, as quickly as I can, on next steps here…I'm deeply sorry that we got into this place, and for my role in it. That's on me, and me alone."

209.title: Nigerian national arrested 2nd time for drug peddling in Bengaluru
209.article_body: A Nigerian national, arrested last year for drug peddling in Bengaluru, has been arrested again after he was caught with 230 grams of MDMA worth ₹20 lakh. According to Bengaluru Police, the accused came to India three years ago on a business visa and got involved in the drug trade by sourcing drugs from a supply chain comprising African individuals.

210.title: Iranian actress Taraneh poses without headscarf amid protests over 22-yr-old's death
210.article_body: Amid anti-government protests in the country, top Iranian actress Taraneh Alidoosti posted an image of herself on Instagram without a headscarf. Alidoosti, best known for her role in the Oscar-winning film 'The Salesman', also held a sign reading, "Woman, Life, Freedom." Protests over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody are entering their seventh week.

211.title: Binance cancels deal to acquire its rival FTX, says 'It's beyond our ability to help'
211.article_body: A day after announcing its plan to acquire its rival FTX, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance, said it will not go ahead with this acquisition. In a statement, Binance said, "In the beginning, our hope was to be able to support FTX's customers to provide liquidity, but the issues are beyond our control or ability to help."

212.title: Man kills 22-yr-old Pune woman after intended marriage breaks off
212.article_body: A man stabbed a 22-year-old woman to death in the parking lot of a residential building in Pune on Wednesday. The man had allegedly been harassing Shweta Ranawade since their intended marriage broke off. Police said a heated argument took place before the man stabbed Shweta multiple times. The two were reportedly in a relationship for the past five years.

213.title: Mumbai woman dies of shock after hearing about husband's death
213.article_body: A 43-year-old woman died of shock after hearing about her husband's death due to heart attack in Mumbai on Monday. Reportedly, her 45-year-old husband complained of chest pain and was rushed to hospital, where he breathed his last at around 10 am. Later, the woman went into shock, became unconscious and passed away due to heart attack at 2 pm.

214.title: FIR filed against Rakhi Sawant for allegedly using Sherlyn Chopra's objectionable video
214.article_body: An FIR has been filed against Rakhi Sawant and her lawyer Falguni Brahmbhatt on complaint of Sherlyn Chopra. Sherlyn has alleged that the two showed an objectionable video of her during a press conference, said Mumbai Police. The FIR has been filed under multiple sections of IPC and IT Act.

215.title: Russia orders withdrawal from Kherson, only regional Ukrainian capital it held
215.article_body: Russia's military has been ordered to pull out of the Ukrainian city of Kherson, the only regional capital it captured after invading Ukraine in February. In televised comments, General Sergei Surovikin said that it was no longer possible to supply Kherson city. Ukraine reacted with caution to the announcement, saying some Russian forces were still in Kherson.

216.title: Saudi Arabia announces launch of country's first EV brand
216.article_body: Saudi Arabia Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman announced the launch of the country's first electric vehicle brand Ceer, which is a joint venture with electronics company Foxconn. Foxconn said that Ceer is projected to contribute $8 billion to Saudi Arabia's GDP by 2034. It hopes to attract $150 million in foreign direct investment to the country and create 30,000 jobs.

217.title: Tata-Airbus project went from Maha to Gujarat due to elections: Rahul
217.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday claimed that the Tata-Airbus transport aircraft project went from Maharashtra to Gujarat due to the upcoming elections in the latter state. "Your projects are going to Gujarat...Even the [Vedanta-Foxconn] project went [there]," the MP said in Maharashtra's Nanded. "Jobs and future of the state's youth are also being snatched," the 52-year-old added.

218.title: I don't see anything dodgy: Novak Djokovic's wife on viral 'secret drink' video
218.article_body: After a video went viral showing Novak Djokovic's team mixing a "secret" drink for him during Paris Masters final and a journalist stated it looked "amazingly dodgy", Djokovic's wife Jelena said, "I don't see anything dodgy." Reacting to a Twitter user asking why Djokovic didn't say what was in the drink, she said, "He'll talk when he's ready to talk."

219.title: SC adjourns demonetisation hearing as govt fails to file affidavit
219.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday adjourned the hearing of pleas against the demonetisation of ₹500 and ₹1,000 notes after the government failed to file an affidavit in the matter. Attorney General R Venkataramani apologised to the court and sought more time to prepare the affidavit. Advocate P Chidambaram called it an embarrassing situation. The hearing was adjourned until November 24.

220.title: Workers protest rising prices in Belgium and Greece
220.article_body: In the latest European agitation over the cost of living crisis, workers in Belgium and Greece held nationwide strikes on Wednesday, disrupting public services. The protests took a violent turn in Greece as some demonstrators threw Molotov cocktails and stones at the police. The violence was brought under control in minutes.

221.title: Didn’t know Bhide, showed him respect as an elderly person: Sudha Murthy
221.article_body: Sudha Murthy, Infosys Co-founder Narayana Murthy's wife, on Wednesday said she didn't know who Sambhaji Bhide was and touched his feet as he's an elderly person. "I don't know about his personal views. It's our tradition to touch the feet of an elderly person," she said. A video of Murthy touching Bhide's feet during an event had recently gone viral.

222.title: Asylum applications to Europe reach high levels of 2015: EU
222.article_body: A European Union (EU) agency on Wednesday said the number of asylum applications the continent is presently receiving has hit the high levels last seen in 2015 when over a million people sought refuge following the Syrian war. "After EU+ countries received unusually high numbers of asylum applications between May and July, this trend has accelerated," EU Asylum Agency said.

223.title: India to be self-sufficient in thermal coal production by FY25: Coal Minister
223.article_body: Union Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi said India would be largely self-sufficient in thermal coal production by the financial year 2024-25. He said that in the sixth phase, commercial auction is being conducted for 141 coal mines across the country, including 28 blocks of Madhya Pradesh. He said the government is expected to earn ₹25,000 crore from the auction.

224.title: Don't want to see an India-Pakistan final: Buttler ahead of T20 WC semi against India
224.article_body: Ahead of India-England T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final, England captain Jos Buttler said, "We certainly don't want to see an India-Pakistan final...so we'll be trying all we can do to make sure that doesn't happen." He added, "We're all really excited about the match...It's going to be a great occasion...and these are times...you want to be involved as a player."

225.title: IMF to give Bangladesh $4.5-billion loan to stabilise its economy
225.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Wednesday reached a preliminary agreement with Bangladesh to give the country a $4.5-billion loan to stabilise its economy. The amount is expected to be disbursed in seven instalments till end of 2026. "We are getting the loan just the way we wanted," said Finance Minister AHM Mustafa Kamal.

226.title: Home sales in top 7 cities hit ₹1.56 lakh crore in H1 of FY23: Report
226.article_body: The top seven Indian cities collectively sold homes worth ₹1,55,833 crore in the first half of FY23, reporting a year-on-year rise of 119%, according to a report by ANAROCK. Between April and September 2022, approximately 1,73,155 homes were sold across the top 7 cities. The Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR) topped the list with housing sales worth ₹74,835 crore.

227.title: I just killed it: Musk after Twitter users lose 'Official' label within hours of launch
227.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk responded, "I just killed it," to popular YouTuber Marques Brownlee after he tweeted that he lost his new 'Official' label released hours ago by Twitter. In another tweet, Musk said, "Please note that Twitter will do lots of dumb things in coming months. We will keep what works & change what doesn't."

228.title: Twitter will do lots of dumb things in the coming months: Elon Musk
228.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted, "Please note that Twitter will do lots of dumb things in the coming months...We'll keep what works & change what doesn't." His tweet came after he claimed to "kill" Twitter's new 'Official' label within hours of launch. Twitter senior executive Esther Crawford said, "Elon is willing to try lots of things, many will fail, some will succeed."

229.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
229.article_body: As per the IMD's latest bulletin, heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Tamil Nadu from November 10 to 13 and over Puducherry on November 10 and 12. Further, it is very likely over Andhra Pradesh from November 11 to 13, and over Karnataka and Kerala on November 12 and 13.

230.title: 5.0-magnitude earthquake hits Japan; no tsunami warning issued
230.article_body: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.0 struck the prefecture of Ibaraki in Japan's northeast of Tokyo on Wednesday at around 5:40 pm, the country's Meteorological Agency said. The agency said there was no tsunami warning in place. It added that there were no early reports of damage or casualties as a result of the earthquake.

231.title: Half-naked body of woman found with broom inserted in rectum in Haryana, rape suspected
231.article_body: A woman was found dead on a street in Haryana's Faridabad, her half-naked body showing signs of rape and brutality, police said on Wednesday. The body was found with a broom handle inserted in rectum. Police added that they suspect the victim may have been raped and post-mortem revealed that the woman, in her 30s, died of suffocation.

232.title: Dengue cases on a downward trend in West Bengal: Mamata
232.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that cases of dengue are reducing in the state and added that they will decrease further with the onset of winter. "Nonetheless, I request everyone to keep their surroundings clean and ensure there is no water accumulation, which causes mosquito breeding that needs to be checked," she said.

233.title: Man charged ₹10 extra for carrying laptop in state transport bus in K'taka
233.article_body: A passenger travelling in a North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation bus was allegedly charged an additional ₹10 for carrying a laptop. He said upon contacting his conductor friends, he came to know that higher authorities have asked some conductors to charge extra for laptops. They're at risk of being fined if they fail to levy the charge, he added.

234.title: Poor lived in kuchha houses, defecated in open before 2014: BJP MP
234.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday said that before the BJP came to power in 2014, the poor lived in kuchha houses and defecated in the open. India's rural poor did not even have bank accounts of their own before PM Narendra Modi was sworn into office, the BJP MP added. Thakur was addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh.

235.title: Man sets wife ablaze after argument over biryani, suffers injuries after she clasps him
235.article_body: A 75-year-old retired Indian Railways official in Tamil Nadu's Chennai set his 65-year-old wife ablaze after an argument over biryani. The woman, who suffered 50% burns, succumbed to her injuries while her husband is in the ICU. The couple lived alone and reportedly struggled with mental illness. After being set ablaze, the woman screamed and hugged her husband.

236.title: To date, SRK is among the best co-stars I have worked with: Shreyas
236.article_body: Actor Shreyas Talpade has said that actor Shah Rukh Khan is one of the best co-stars he has worked with. "Obviously, he's a superstar for a reason," he added. Both of them worked together in the 2007 film 'Om Shanti Om'. Shreyas further stated that he had a yes in his mind before he even heard the film's story.

237.title: Film with dad Big B is long overdue, I'd love to work with him: Abhishek
237.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that a film with his father and veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan is long overdue. "I'd love that. I'd love to work with him again. 'Paa' was the last time we worked together which released in 2009, so it's long overdue," he stated. Abhishek and Amitabh have also worked in 'Bunty Aur Babli' and 'Sarkar'.

238.title: UCC not linked to elections, will implement it: Uttarakhand CM Dhami
238.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday said that Uniform Civil Code (UCC) is not linked to elections and asserted his state will implement it. He said a five-member committee headed by a retired Supreme Court judge is working on a draft, which will be ready soon. Higher judiciary is of the view that states should implement it, he added.

239.title: Farah wanted revealing clothes for background dancers: 'Om Shanti Om' writer
239.article_body: 'Om Shanti Om' writer Mushtaq Shiekh, in his book 'The Making of Om Shanti Om', wrote Farah Khan wanted revealing clothes for background dancers in one of the film's songs. As per Mushtaq, Farah wanted such clothes for authenticity's sake as the song was set in the 70s. "The junior artists rebelled...they'd to cover up all the cleavages," Shiekh stated.

240.title: HC tells Centre to place on record reply to 'Vande Mataram' PIL
240.article_body: The Delhi High Court has given the Centre two weeks to place on record a response to a PIL seeking 'Vande Mataram' be given equal status to the national anthem. The bench said the reply had been filed but wasn't on record. The court further asked that the matter be listed for hearing on December 22.

241.title: BR Ambedkar's statue vandalised in UP's Prayagraj
241.article_body: A statue of BR Ambedkar was vandalised by unidentified persons at a village in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, police said on Wednesday. Efforts are on to identify those who damaged the statue, CO Ajeet Chauhan said, adding the locals are getting another statue installed in its place. Uttar Pradesh Scheduled Castes Finance and Development Corporation chairperson called the incident "unfortunate".

242.title: Tera number lagne wala hai: Shiv Sena (Taksali) leader gets death threat
242.article_body: Shiv Sena (Taksali) Punjab Chairman Sunil Kumar has received a death threat, days after another party leader, Sudhir Suri, was shot dead in Amritsar. The caller told Kumar, "Tera number lagne wala hai. Aur ab tera kya banta hai dekhta ja (You are next. Just wait and watch what happens to you)." Suri was shot dead during a sit-in protest.

243.title: Three JeM operatives arrested in Jammu, weapons seized: J&K Police
243.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police has arrested three alleged Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) operatives and seized a cache of arms from them in Jammu, said an official on Wednesday. The recovered ammunition included three AK assault rifles, one pistol and six grenades. The weapons were found in an oil tanker in Jammu's Narwal area.

244.title: We are fighters, will continue to fight, says Raut after coming out of jail
244.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut stepped out of Mumbai's Arthur Road jail after the court granted him bail in a money-laundering case and said, "We are fighters, will continue to fight". Uddhav Thackeray-led Sena leader Sushma Andhare on Wednesday said, "Tiger is back" as Raut was granted bail. "Our Diwali begins today," said Raut's brother Sunil Raut.

245.title: Global Dental Services raises $66 million in growth funding
245.article_body: Global Dental Services (GDS), which operates the nationwide chain of oral care clinics Clove Dental, has raised $66 million in growth funding led by Bahrain-based Investcorp. Growth investor Tybourne Capital, as well as new and existing shareholders, also participated in the capital raising round. The investment is expected to fund GDS' expansion to 1,000 clinics in the next five years.

246.title: SC dismisses PIL challenging ex-CJI Ranjan Gogoi's nomination to RS
246.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Wednesday dismissed a public interest litigation (PIL) challenging the nomination of ex-Chief Justice of India (CJI) Ranjan Gogoi to Rajya Sabha. Petitioner Satish S Kambiye contended Gogoi was not eligible to be nominated. "Who will decide the eligibility? You? Sorry, we don't find any merit in this plea," the SC bench said.

247.title: Police to start receiving complaints online, mobile app to be launched: Goa CM
247.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that police will soon start receiving complaints online, adding that a dedicated mobile phone application will be launched. For filing a complaint online, a person will need to provide identity proof which will prevent registration of bogus cases, Sawant said. People should be alert about the new techniques used by conmen, he added.

248.title: Man set on fire by son, daughter-in-law over property dispute in Maha
248.article_body: A 79-year-old man suffered burn injuries after his son and daughter-in-law set him on fire over a property dispute in Maharashtra's Kolhapur, police said on Wednesday. "When the...man went to the toilet, his son allegedly threw some inflammable substance in the lavatory and set it on fire," a police official said. The couple is absconding after the incident, police added.

249.title: Govt to sell 1.55% stake in Axis Bank via OFS on Nov 10-11
249.article_body: The government has decided to sell the 1.55% stake in Axis Bank held by Specified Undertaking of The Unit Trust of India (SUUTI) on exchanges via the Offer For Sale mechanism. According to a regulatory filing, 4.65 crore shares of Axis Bank will be sold on November 10 and 11 at a floor price of ₹830.63 per share.

250.title: Recruited very young team members: Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar
250.article_body: Nykaa Founder and CEO Falguni Nayar said that the beauty retailer mostly hired young talent straight from colleges. Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, Nayar added that while hiring, the criteria was to judge how passionate a candidate was for Nykaa. She also credited the initial success of her brand to millennial consumers who were exposed to social media.

251.title: Home Secretaries in 9 states granted citizenship to foreigners: Report
251.article_body: Home Secretaries in nine states and District Magistrates in 31 districts are permitted to grant Indian citizenship to Hindus, Sikhs, Buddhists, Jains, Parsis and Christians coming from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan. The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) said 1,414 people from these countries were given Indian citizenship from April 1 to December 31, 2021 under the Citizenship Act, 1955.

252.title: Govt allows trade settlements in rupees for export promotion schemes
252.article_body: The Commerce Ministry said it has allowed international trade settlements in rupees for export promotion schemes under the Foreign Trade Policy. The changes mean benefits, incentives, and fulfilment of export obligation under the Foreign Trade Policy can be extended to export payments made in Indian rupees, as outlined by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) in July.

253.title: Twitter's new 'Official' label starts appearing on verified accounts in India
253.article_body: Twitter's new 'Official' label began appearing on verified profiles in India on Wednesday. It appeared on the Twitter handles of PM Narendra Modi, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Union Minister Amit Shah and others. According to Twitter, government accounts, commercial companies, business partners, major media outlets, publishers and some public figures will get the new 'Official' label.

254.title: After dating Kanye, I'm not getting as many acting offers as before: Julia
254.article_body: Actress Julia Fox has said that she has noticed a shift in her acting career after dating rapper Kanye West. "I'm not getting as many offers as I was before, weirdly. There's been a lot of weird drawbacks with reaching that level of notoriety," she added. The duo dated briefly after Kim Kardashian filed for divorce from Kanye.

255.title: NGT panel to verify 'factual position' of Narmada river pollution
255.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has formed a panel to check the "factual position" of sewage being discharged into Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Dindori district. The NGT has asked the committee to submit its report in a month's time. The NGT formed the panel as it was hearing a petition which raised environmental concerns.

256.title: Started Bharat Jodo Yatra because media doesn't raise our issues: Rahul
256.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "We started Bharat Jodo Yatra because the media doesn't raise our issues." "In the Parliament, when we keep our issues, our mics are turned off within two minutes. Our mics are turned off when we speak about demonetisation, Chinese Army intrusion," Gandhi said. Notably, the Bharat Jodo Yatra entered Maharashtra on Monday night.

257.title: Video shows students being paraded half-naked inside men's hostel in TN medical college
257.article_body: Seven medical students have been suspended from a college in Tamil Nadu's Vellore over alleged ragging. A purported video of the incident, which happened at Christian Medical College, has been shared widely on social media. The video shows students being paraded half-naked inside the men's hostel and water being sprayed on them from a hose.

258.title: Why am I categorised as mother-of-two? Am I not an individual?: Urvashi
258.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia said she's always categorised as a mother-of-two whenever she posts something on social media. She added, "Why? Am I not an individual...then a mother of two kids? Does anyone say this to a man?" This comes after Urvashi posted pictures on Instagram of herself in a bikini and penned a note on body positivity.

259.title: Ghazipur landfill trash dumped nearby to show height has come down: AAP
259.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday alleged that BJP-led MCD took garbage from the Ghazipur landfill and dumped it in nearby areas to show that its height had come down. MCD Director (Press and Information) Amit Kumar, however, denied such allegations and said, "The waste from above is brought to the locations of trommel machines for bio-remediation."

260.title: China faces instability, be ready to fight & win wars: Xi to military
260.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has warned the military that the country's national security is facing increased "instability" and "uncertainty", a report said. He instructed them to enhance capabilities to "fight and win" wars. "The...military should devote all of its energy to...combat readiness, enhance its capability to fight and win, and...fulfil its missions and tasks in the new era," Xi said.

261.title: Rare pear-shaped pink diamond sold for ₹235 crore; pics surface
261.article_body: A rare 18.18-carat pear-shaped 'Fortune Pink Diamond' was sold for 28.4 million Swiss francs (over ₹235 crore) at a Christie's sale of rare jewels in Geneva. It's the largest pear-shaped fancy vivid pink diamond ever put up for auction. The auction house said an unidentified Asian buyer bought the diamond.

262.title: Gunathilaka refused to wear condom, choked Tinder date 3 times: Court documents
262.article_body: As per a police facts sheet released by a court, Sri Lanka cricketer Danushka Gunathilaka, who's under arrest in Australia on rape charges, met the victim through Tinder. Gunathilaka allegedly choked the Sydney woman thrice and also refused to wear condom. The woman underwent brain scan to check for any injury resulting from choking, the documents added.

263.title: Archana Gautam evicted from 'Bigg Boss 16' after getting violent: Report
263.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Archana Gautam has reportedly been evicted from the show after she got physically violent with co-contestant Shiv Thakare. As per a source, Archana tried to strangulate Shiv during a heated argument. "The makers themselves saw the footage and took the fair decision of expelling Archana from the game for her violent actions," the source added.

264.title: Tejashwi seeks special status for Bihar as 'birthday gift' from BJP
264.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday sought special status for the state from BJP on the occasion of his birthday. "It will benefit the state's huge young population," he said. The RJD leader was speaking at a function where letters of appointment were given away to recruits in departments of science and technology and Panchayati Raj.

265.title: PM Modi, Nadda attend BJP meet to finalise candidates for Gujarat polls
265.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP National President JP Nadda, Home Minister Amit Shah and other senior leaders arrived at the BJP's headquarters in Delhi on Wednesday for the party's Central Election Committee meeting. The meeting was held to finalise the party's candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel also attended the meeting.

266.title: Civic body allows Tipu Jayanti celebrations at Hubballi's Idgah Maidan
266.article_body: The municipal corporation of Karnataka's Hubballi has granted permission to celebrate Tipu Jayanti and Kanakadasa Jayanti at Idgah Maidan on November 10 and 11 respectively. Permission has also been granted for celebration of birth anniversaries of other national heroes and religious leaders at the ground. A fee of ₹10,000 will have to be given to the corporation for such events.

267.title: Pakistan to get $500 million from AIIB for development program
267.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Ishaq Dar said that Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) will give $500 million to Pakistan as co-financing for a development program. The fund will be used for Asian Development Bank's Building Resilience with Active Countercyclical Expenditures (BRACE) program to counter the social fallouts of economic crisis. Dar said, "The fund will be received in November."

268.title: Guj ex-CM Vijay Rupani, ex-Deputy CM Nitin Patel won't contest Assembly polls
268.article_body: Gujarat's former CM Vijay Rupani and former Deputy CM Nitin Patel on Wednesday confirmed that they'll not be contesting the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. "I worked as CM for five years with everyone's cooperation. In these polls, responsibility should be given to new workers," Rupani said. Senior BJP MLA Bhupendrasinh Chudasama said he won't be contesting the upcoming polls either.

269.title: It was a mistake: Karnataka govt on circular to bring college students for PM event
269.article_body: Karnataka government has called the circular by Pre University Education Department that directed colleges in Bengaluru to send students for PM Modi's rally on November 11 'a mistake' after withdrawing it on Tuesday. "It was a mistake done by the DDPI (Deputy Director of Public Instruction) and we have initiated action against the official," Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said.

270.title: Wake up ECI: Mahua Moitra over sale of electoral bonds ahead of polls
270.article_body: In response to the government's amendment to the electoral bond scheme, Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra tweeted, "Wake up ECI." Calling the amendment a clear violation of the model code of conduct in place for Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, she said that the electoral bond sale will allow "more anonymous BJP donations" for the upcoming election campaigns.

271.title: Shoaib Malik, Waqar & Akram dance in studio as Pakistan reach T20 WC final, video viral
271.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Shoaib Malik, Waqar Younis, Wasim Akram and Misbah-ul-Haq dancing in the studio to celebrate Pakistan's victory over New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final on Wednesday. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "Every Pakistani right now!" Pakistan defeated New Zealand by seven wickets.

272.title: It is crazy & scary what is happening today in the crypto world: Zerodha CEO
272.article_body: India's largest stockbroker Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath on Wednesday said, "It is crazy and scary what is happening today in the crypto world." He added that India's capital market infrastructure and regulations don't get enough credit for being among the best in the world. Kamath's remarks came after the world's largest crypto exchange Binance bought its rival FTX.

273.title: Activists throw cow dung on group for biryani feast during lunar eclipse in Odisha
273.article_body: A clash broke out between Bajrang Dal, Vishva Hindu Parishad, Brahman Samaj members and a group of 'rationalists' who had organised a biryani feast during lunar eclipse in Odisha's Bhubaneswar. The event defied the popular Hindu tradition of avoiding cooked food during eclipse. The activists reportedly threw cow dung on the group to oppose it, leading to a clash.

274.title: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut walks out of jail after 101 days, pics surface
274.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut walked out of Mumbai's Arthur Road jail on Wednesday, 101 days after being arrested in a money laundering case. "I'm happy. We had faith in the judiciary. It has increased further," Raut said after walking out of the jail. He was granted bail by a special court earlier in the day.

275.title: Kohli takes a blow on body during practice ahead of T20 WC semi-final, video surfaces
275.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli took a blow on the body during net practice while batting against Harshal Patel ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final. Kohli was hit in groin area and was seen kneeling on the ground in pain. In the video, Harshal Patel can be seen checking up on him. Kohli continued practice after recovering from the pain.

276.title: I make macho movies for SRK, others make girly movies for him: Farah
276.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan said that she is the only director who makes "macho movies" for actor Shah Rukh Khan, as per the book 'The Making Of Om Shanti Om'. Farah added, "Everyone has him doing girly movies. I hate it when he does this weepy, mushy stuff." The book was written by 'Om Shanti Om' writer Mushtaq Shaikh.

277.title: Ranbir, I shared our dirty secrets to gain confidence: Imtiaz on Rockstar
277.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali revealed that he and actor Ranbir Kapoor "deliberately" broke the ice between them before 'Rockstar'. "We...shared our dirty secrets, our vulnerabilities, we confessed to each other all the sh*t we were doing at that point [in] time. That way, we gained each other's confidence," he stated. Imtiaz added Ranbir was the second-most informed person about the film.

278.title: 11-year-old boy in Assam identifies man who killed, raped 13-yr-old sister
278.article_body: Police on Wednesday said an 11-year-old boy in Assam's Cachar identified his 43-year-old neighbour as the person accused of raping and killing his 13-year-old sister. The man gave police directions to the bush where he had dumped the girl's body. The boy claimed the man had offered him and his sister chocolates, but the boy declined.

279.title: Couple celebrate lambs birthday by cutting cake, inviting DJ in UP
279.article_body: A video showing a childless couple in UP celebrating the birthday of their goat's kids by cutting a cake and inviting a DJ has gone viral on the internet. In the video, the couple can be seen celebrating the event with several guests. They also brought gifts, including blankets, said Raja, the goat’s owner.

280.title: Adani Ports to buy 49.38% stake in Indian Oiltanking for ₹1,050 crore
280.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) has entered into a definitive agreement for acquisition of Oiltanking India GmbH's 49.38% equity stake in Indian Oiltanking Ltd (IOTL). The agreement also includes acquisition of an additional 10% equity stake in IOT Utkal Energy Services Ltd. APSEZ CEO Karan Adani said with this, APSEZ becomes India’s largest third-party liquid tank storage company.

281.title: K'taka Congress leader Jarkiholi withdraws 'Hindu' remark, issues apology
281.article_body: Karnataka Congress Working President Satish Jarkiholi, who faced backlash for his statement on origin of the word 'Hindu', has withdrawn his remarks and issued an apology. "There's a conspiracy to project me as anti-Hindu," Jarkiholi said and sought formation of a committee to investigate the matter. Jarkiholi earlier said he was only referring to what has been written and published.

282.title: Eggs thrown at King Charles while he greets people, video surfaces
282.article_body: A man was detained on Wednesday after eggs were thrown at King Charles and Camilla, his wife and queen consort, as they carried out an engagement in England. Footage showed four eggs flying past them and smashing on the ground as they arrived for a traditional ceremony in York. They appeared to be unmoved and carried on with the engagement.

283.title: BJP can't fool people of state with its 'jumlas': Kharge in Himachal
283.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday criticised BJP and said it may have fooled people across the country with its "jumlas", but cannot do so in Himachal Pradesh. Addressing a rally in Himachal Pradesh ahead of Assembly elections, he said, "People here are educated, understand everything and take a considered decision." Old pension scheme will be implemented first, he added.

284.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has come as 'Sanjeevani' for Congress: Jairam
284.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' has come as a 'Sanjeevani' for the Congress. Addressing a press conference in Maharashtra's Naigaon, Ramesh said that there's a new wave of energy amongst the Congress members, workers, and supporters. They are hopeful for a bright future, seeing the success of the Yatra and people's support, he added.

285.title: Will request Centre to start Mumbai-Birmingham air service: Maha CM
285.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said the state government will request the Centre to start a direct air service between Mumbai and Birmingham, England. This comes as West Midlands Mayor Andy Street visited Shinde in Mumbai and discussed investment opportunities in Maharashtra. Street told the CM that a flight service between the cities will provide a scope for tourism.

286.title: 3 killed, 1 injured as dumper hits motorcycle in WB's Howrah
286.article_body: Three persons were killed and one person was injured after a dumper hit their motorcycle in West Bengal's Howrah district on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place when 32-year-old Deep Mondal was travelling to Ghoshal Chak along with his family. Police said that 26-year-old Papiya Mondal, 2-year-old Prithvis Mondal and 6-year-old Bidisha Mondal died on the spot.

287.title: HC dismisses plea against acquittal of Advani, others in Babri Masjid case
287.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea challenging the acquittal of 32 accused including BJP leader LK Advani in the Babri Masjid demolition case. In their petition, appellants Haji Mahboob and Syed Akhlaq called themselves "victims" of the demolition. The state government argued that they weren't complainants or victims in the case and, therefore, cannot appeal as a stranger.

288.title: I heard loud noises behind me: Katrina recalls fight over 'shoes' at her wedding
288.article_body: Katrina Kaif said that a fight broke out between her sisters and Vicky Kaushal's friends at their wedding. "I was hearing very loud noises behind me. As I turned, I saw everyone fighting and pulling the shoes toward themselves," Katrina said. She added she doesn't know who won the fight. "I was so busy that I couldn't ask," she said.

289.title: No access to systems, e-mail active today for farewells: Meta to fired staff
289.article_body: Meta removed access to most Meta systems for over 11,000 people it laid off on Wednesday, citing "the amount of access to sensitive information". "We're keeping email addresses active throughout the day so everyone can say farewell," Meta added. Impacted employees will get 16 weeks of base pay plus two additional weeks for every year of service, with no cap.

290.title: Voting for 7,751 gram panchayats in Maharashtra to be held on December 18
290.article_body: The State Election Commission announced that the voting for elections of 7,751 gram panchayats in Maharashtra will be held on December 18. It includes direct elections of Sarpanch posts along with member posts of gram panchayats across several districts in the state, State Election Commissioner UPS Madan informed.

291.title: Mumbai's Gokhale bridge to be reopened by September 2023: BMC
291.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday announced that Gopal Krishna Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri will be reopened by September 2023. "[The bridge's] two lanes will be opened for traffic by end of May 2023," BMC's statement read. "BMC has contacted IIT Bombay to clear the Railway Bridge design...and IIT has decided to clear [it] within this week," it added.

292.title: Oldest known complete written sentence found on a comb in Israel
292.article_body: Israeli archaeologists have found an ancient comb dating back some 3,700 years ago and bearing what is likely the oldest known full sentence written in the earliest alphabet. Written in Canaanite alphabetical script, the sentence contains 17 letters that read: "May this tusk root out the lice of the hair and the beard."

293.title: Pakistan break world record for winning most T20I matches against a team
293.article_body: Pakistan on Wednesday broke the world record for winning most T20I matches against a team. Pakistan's victory in T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final was their 18th victory against New Zealand in T20I cricket. Pakistan overtook England, who have recorded 17 victories against Pakistan. They also overtook India, who have recorded 17 wins each against Sri Lanka and West Indies.

294.title: Meta's fired employees to get at least 4 months of base pay, immigration support
294.article_body: Meta will pay over 11,000 laid-off employees 16 weeks of base pay plus two additional weeks for every year of service, with no cap. On stocks, Meta said the employees will receive their November 15, 2022 vesting. For those in the US on visas, a notice period before termination, visa grace periods and immigration support will be provided.

295.title: Cong to restore old pension scheme in HP: Chhattisgarh CM
295.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel told people of Himachal Pradesh that Congress will fulfil all its promises such as restoring the old pension scheme and providing 300 units of free power. "The Congress does what it says. All promises will be fulfilled in Himachal as has been done in Chhattisgarh," he added. Himachal Pradesh will go to polls on November 12.

296.title: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried loses billionaire status as his wealth falls by 94% in 1 day
296.article_body: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, 30, lost his billionaire status after his wealth declined by 94% from $16 billion to $991.5 million in a single day. On Tuesday, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao announced that the company will acquire FTX as the latter "asked for help" amid a liquidity crunch. Notably, the Binance doesn't involve FTX.US, a separate exchange owned by Bankman-Fried.

297.title: Over 30 startup founders team up to make Mumbai 'startup hub': Report
297.article_body: Over 30 Mumbai-based startup founders have reportedly come together to form a non-profit organisation to promote startup and entrepreneurship culture and establish the city as a 'startup hub'. The organisation is expected to be named TEAM (Tech Entrepreneurs Association of Mumbai). TEAM will include founders of startups such as Pepperfry, PharmEasy, upGrad, Good Glamm Group, Zepto, among others.

298.title: 'Tiger is back', says Uddhav-led Shiv Sena as court grants bail to Raut
298.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena leader Sushma Andhare on Wednesday said, "Tiger is back" as Sanjay Raut was granted bail by a Mumbai court in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project. "These are tears of joy. Our Diwali begins today. Satyamev Jayate", said Raut's brother Sunil Raut, adding that his brother was arrested deliberately.

299.title: 11 cheat 1,700 people on pretext of giving loans in Delhi; arrested
299.article_body: Police have busted a fake call centre in Delhi and have arrested 11 people, including six women, for allegedly cheating over 1,700 people on the pretext of providing them loans, police said on Wednesday. The call centre, disguised as a medical supply store, was operational since February this year and the accused cheated people of over ₹1 crore, reports said.

300.title: Finance Ministry finalises framework to issue sovereign green bonds
300.article_body: The Finance Ministry has released the framework to issue sovereign green bonds in line with global standards. The government plans to mobilise ₹16,000 crore during the second half of the current financial year. The framework will be used to fund green projects like renewable energy, clean transportation, sustainable water and waste management, pollution prevention and control, and green buildings.

301.title: Keka raises $57 million in funding from WestBridge Capital
301.article_body: HRtech startup Keka said it has secured Series A funding of $57 million from WestBridge Capital, in what it claimed was the largest ever Series A SaaS funding round in India. The company said it had more than 5,500 customers by 2021. Founder Vijay Yalamanchili said they now want to augment the product, enhance their offerings, and improve customer support.

302.title: PM to inaugurate B'luru airport's T2 on Nov 11, flag off Vande Bharat train
302.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport's Terminal 2 on Friday, November 11. The new terminal has been built at a cost of ₹5,000 crore. PM Modi will also flag off south India's first Vande Bharat Express to serve the Chennai-Bengaluru-Mysuru route. He will also unveil the 108-feet-tall bronze statue of Bengaluru founder Nadaprabhu Kempegowda.

303.title: BBMP undertakes several repair works ahead of PM Modi's B'luru visit
303.article_body: Ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bengaluru visit on November 11 (Friday), the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has taken up several repair works in the city. The BBMP has already laid an asphalt layer on Belathur Road in Majestic and Kadugodi. The civic body is also giving a facelift to the rear entrance of Krantiveera Sangolli Rayanna Railway Station.

304.title: BJP 'using' CAA, NRC with eye on Gujarat Assembly polls: WB CM
304.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday claimed that BJP was "using" Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register of Citizens (NRC) with an eye on the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. "The BJP is fanning separatism in West Bengal by instigating Rajbanshis and Gorkhas in northern parts of the state," she said. "We'll never allow...division of West Bengal," she added.

305.title: Mumbai's air quality drops to 'poor' category, AQI rises to 215
305.article_body: After staying in the "moderate" range for the last two weeks, the air quality of Mumbai dropped to the "poor" category again on Wednesday. According to Air Quality Index (AQI) readings, the city's AQI read 215 on Wednesday afternoon. The Malad area recorded the worst AQI reading of 276, followed by Mazagaon with 242 and Bandra Kurla Complex with 235.

306.title: What changes is Meta making to cut costs after firing 11,000 employees?
306.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who laid off 11,000 employees, said the company will extend hiring freeze through Q1 and shrink its real estate footprint to cut costs. Meta will transition to desk sharing for people who already spend most of their time outside the office. "We've cut costs across our business, including scaling back budgets and reducing perks," he added.

307.title: 'Master chef' Gadkari fully baked 1991 reforms by lauding Manmohan: Cong
307.article_body: Criticising Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for her remarks calling the 1991 reforms "half-baked", Congress on Wednesday said that "master chef" Nitin Gadkari has baked it fully by paying tribute to former PM Manmohan Singh. Union Minister Gadkari on Tuesday said that India was indebted to Singh for the economic reforms of 1991 started by him as the Finance Minister.

308.title: Uttarakhand CM Dhami pays tribute to martyrs on Foundation Day
308.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday paid his tribute to the martyrs of the state on the occasion of Uttarakhand Foundation Day at the martyrs memorial in Dehradun. "It has been 22 years since the foundation of the state of Uttarakhand," Dhami said. "We are determined to build Uttarakhand as per their (martyrs and revolutionaries) visions," he added.

309.title: Video shows Noida woman sitting on moving car's bonnet; vehicle seized
309.article_body: Noida Police have seized a Scorpio car after a video of a young woman performing stunts on the vehicle went viral. The video showed the woman sitting on the bonnet of the car as the vehicle moved slowly on a road. The incident reportedly took place in Sector 24. Police said the vehicle was being driven in a dangerous manner.

310.title: Australia reviewing military secrecy safeguards amidst Chinese concerns
310.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Richard Marles on Wednesday said his country's military has been told to review its secrecy safeguards amidst reports that the Chinese government had recruited Australian pilots. "In the information that has now been provided...there are enough concerns," he said, adding that an examination of the policies applicable to former defence personnel will be carried out.

311.title: Our Diwali begins today, Satyamev Jayate: Sanjay Raut's brother on his bail
311.article_body: After Shiv Sena leader and MP Sanjay Raut was granted bail in Patra Chawl money laundering case, his brother Sandip Raut said, "These are tears of joy. Our Diwali begins today. Satyamev Jayate!" "We were 100% confident that (Sanjay Raut will be released), he had done nothing wrong. All of this was done deliberately," Sandip Raut added.

312.title: Trees being translocated: Govt on removal of trees for Formula E in Hyd
312.article_body: After receiving backlash over the removal of trees on NTR Marg to pave way for Formula E race track, the Telangana government on Tuesday said that the trees have been translocated. The trees, including Royal Palm trees, on the 2.37 km track around Hussain Sagar Lake are being translocated to NTR Garden and Sanjeevaiah Park, the government stated.

313.title: Bengaluru Police unearths over ₹90-crore cooperative society scam
313.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested five persons in an alleged cooperative society scam with irregularities of over ₹90 crore. Kuruhinasetty Souharda Credit Co-operative Society is reported to have issued loans to some individuals without necessary paper-work and in some cases the loan amount was greater in value than the mortgaged properties. More arrests are likely in the case, police said.

314.title: Kartik Aaryan gained 14 kg for his film 'Freddy', reveals trainer
314.article_body: Celebrity fitness trainer Samir Jaura, who worked with Kartik Aaryan through this transformation for 'Freddy', revealed that the actor gained around 14 kg for the movie. "Kartik is someone with a genetically lean body...We knew it was going to be a task. But, his dedication is next level," said Samir. "He...[followed] disciplined routine workouts and...right diet plan," Samir added.

315.title: Sean Penn hands his Oscar award to Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy, shares video
315.article_body: Amid the war between Russia and Ukraine, actor Sean Penn handed over his Oscar trophy to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The Ukrainian President shared the video on Instagram. In the video, Sean said, "This is for you. It's just a symbolic silly thing, but if I know this is here then I'll feel better and strong enough for the fights."

316.title: Nobody knows how JP Nadda was appointed as BJP Prez: Congress' Kharge
316.article_body: Addressing a rally ahead of Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticised the Bharatiya Janata Party. He said, "BJP always alleges that there is no democracy in Congress," adding, "I have been elected as Congress President with a fair voting system, but nobody knows how was JP Nadda appointed as BJP's President."

317.title: 2.49 lakh voters aged above 100 in India: CEC Rajiv Kumar
317.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar said that India has 2.49 lakh voters above the age of 100. He added that there are 1.80 crore voters who are above 80 years of age. "What a relief and ecstasy it gives when you interact with them and find that they have been voting all through their lives," Kumar said.

318.title: Zuckerberg explains why Meta fired 11,000 staff, says 'I take responsibility'
318.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg took responsibility for firing over 11,000 employees. He said he predicted the accelerated e-commerce growth would continue after Covid and Meta significantly increased its e-commerce investments. "Not only has e-commerce returned to prior trends, but the macroeconomic downturn, increased competition, and ads signal loss have caused our revenue to be lower," he added.

319.title: Delhi's RML Hospital asks doctors to avoid casual clothes on campus
319.article_body: The Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital and Atal Bihari Vajpayee Institute of Medical Sciences (ABVIMS) in New Delhi have advised doctors to stay in proper attire while on the hospital campus. "Casual and party attire should be strictly avoided," said the order issued by Additional Medical Superintendent Dheeraj Bahl. Corrective action will be taken against those who don't wear proper attire.

320.title: Thank the UK government for longstanding support: Taiwanese Prez
320.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday thanked British Minister Greg Hands for visiting the self-ruled island, amidst pressure from China which claims Taiwan as its territory. "Let me take this opportunity to thank the government of the United Kingdom for its longstanding support," Tsai said. She hoped for "new heights" in ties with Britain which recently exited the European Union.

321.title: Kejriwal should undergo narco test: Cong on conman Sukesh's allegations
321.article_body: Congress leader Ajoy Kumar has demanded narco analysis tests for AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and AAP's Satyendar Jain over the allegations of conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. Kumar said, "This is...first time in the country, someone has clearly written that he has given a certain amount of money to any CM." Kumar also demanded a narco test for Chandrashekhar.

322.title: US-based startup Eliyan raises $40 mn from Intel Capital & others
322.article_body: Eliyan, a US-based chiplet interconnect startup, has secured $40 million in a Series A funding round which saw participation from Intel Capital and Micron Ventures. The funding round was led by Tracker Capital and got additional investment from Celesta Capital. The company was co-founded by Ramin Farjadrad, Patrick Soheili and Syrus Ziai.

323.title: Man stabbed with beer bottle at 24x7 shop in Gurugram
323.article_body: Four men reportedly stabbed a 32-year-old man in the abdomen with a broken beer bottle at a 24x7 shop in Gurugram. According to the complainant, Aman Sheoran, an altercation broke out between his friend and the accused outside the shop, following which they started assaulting him. When Aman intervened they smashed a beer bottle on his head and stabbed him.

324.title: Facebook parent Meta fires more than 11,000 employees worldwide
324.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta on Wednesday announced it is laying off 13% of its entire workforce, affecting more than 11,000 employees. "I want to take accountability for these decisions and for how we got here," said Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg. "In this new environment, we need to become more capital efficient," he added.

325.title: Reports on ISMC Analog stake deal not related to company: HCL Tech
325.article_body: HCL Tech clarified that reports, claiming Reliance Industries Limited and HCL were independently "evaluating" deals to pick up a 30% equity stake each in semiconductor wafer fab applicant ISMC Analog, are not related to the company. However, those are pertaining to the HCL Group. RIL and HCL Group could reportedly invest through subsidiaries and total investment could exceed ₹4,000 crore.

326.title: CureBay raises ₹50 crore in Series A round led by Elevar Equity
326.article_body: Healthtech startup CureBay has secured ₹50 crore in Series A funding round led by Elevar Equity. The startup was founded in 2021 by Priyadarshi Mohapatra, Shobhan Mahapatra and Sanjay Swain. The Odisha-based company has planned to use funds to hire more people, expand to new locations and invest in tech.

327.title: Secunderabad Police recover 30 stolen bikes, 3 bike offenders held
327.article_body: The Secunderabad Police on Monday arrested three bike offenders and recovered 30 stolen bikes from them. Police began investigating after a complaint of a missing bike was registered by a Secunderabad resident on October 22. The accused were identified as 20-year-old Mohammed Awais and 36-year-old Vithanala Srinivas, who confessed during interrogation. The receiver of the bikes was also arrested.

328.title: UAE & Egypt to build one of world's biggest wind farms: Report
328.article_body: The Presidents of the United Arab Emirates and Egypt witnessed signing of a deal to develop one of the world's largest onshore wind projects in Egypt, the Gulf nation's state news agency reported. The project will help produce 47,790 gigawatt hours of clean energy annually. "The UAE and Masdar will...support Egypt's net-zero goals," Masdar Chairman Sultan Al Jaber said.

329.title: Europe experiences warmest October on record: EU climate monitor
329.article_body: Europe experienced its warmest October on record, the EU's Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S) said, as temperatures were nearly 2 degrees Celsius above the average for the 1991-2020 reference period. "The severe consequences of climate change are very visible today and we need ambitious climate action at COP27," C3S Deputy Director Samantha Burgess said.

330.title: Eng feel they can contain Kohli, Suryakumar is unpredictable: Agnew
330.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Jonathan Agnew said England will believe that they can "contain" Virat Kohli when they bowl to him in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final between England and India. "England know Kohli very well...Suryakumar Yadav is more unpredictable...England...have to control him somehow...He destroyed Zimbabwe," added Agnew. Suryakumar has scored 225 runs in T20 World Cup 2022 so far.

331.title: Pakistan defeat New Zealand to reach T20 World Cup final after 13 years
331.article_body: Pakistan defeated New Zealand by seven wickets in the first semi-final of T20 World Cup 2022 on Wednesday. With this, Pakistan reached T20 World Cup final after 13 years. Pakistan were the runners-up in inaugural edition of T20 World Cup in 2007 and had won the tournament in 2009. Pakistan will face either India or England in the final.

332.title: Monkey gets stuck in wheel of speeding bike in UP, video surfaces
332.article_body: A video of a monkey being stuck in the front wheel of a bike in Uttar Pradesh has surfaced online. The incident took place while the monkey was trying to cross a road and got caught in the wheel of the speeding bike. Later, the locals gathered around and opened the front wheel of the bike to free the monkey.

333.title: ED raids Telangana Minister Gangula Kamalakar's properties in illegal mining case
333.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate is conducting raids at the properties linked to TRS leader and Telangana Minister Gangula Kamalakar in connection with an illegal mining and money laundering case, reports stated. Several granite companies in Karimnagar and Hyderabad are being raided by ED following a complaint that stated many granite enterprises in the state were mining granite unlawfully.

334.title: Nirav Modi to be extradited to India after he loses appeal in UK High Court
334.article_body: The UK High Court has rejected the appeal of fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi while ordering his extradition to India to face charges of fraud and money laundering in the ₹14,000-crore Punjab National Bank loan scam case. Notably, the UK court said that extraditing Nirav Modi won’t be unjust or oppressive. He is currently behind bars at London's Wandsworth prison.

335.title: Babar-Rizwan create history, become first pair to share 3 century partnerships in T20 WCs
335.article_body: Pakistan openers Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan on Wednesday created history by becoming the first pair to share three century partnerships in T20 World Cups. The duo shared a 105-run stand against New Zealand in the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final to set the record. Five other pairs have recorded two century partnerships each in T20 World Cups.

336.title: Justice Chandrachud's pics with foster daughters at home before taking oath as CJI go viral
336.article_body: Supreme Court Chief Justice DY Chandrachud's photos with his wife Kalpana Das and foster daughters Priyanka and Mahi at their residence have gone viral on social media. The photos were clicked by The Indian Express photojournalist Tashi Tobgyal on Tuesday. Justice Chandrachud was sworn in as the 50th Chief Justice of India today.

337.title: TN man starts his own bank with 9 branches, cheats thousands of people
337.article_body: A 44-year-old man named Chandrabose has been arrested from Chennai for cheating thousands of people by opening his own bank - Rural and Agricultural Farmer's Cooperative Bank. The bank had nine branches across Tamil Nadu and collected unauthorised deposits of ₹2 lakh to ₹7 lakh. Police have recovered documents, a luxury car, and ₹56.6 lakh in cash from the accused.

338.title: Maha CM orders reconstruction of Mumbai's Gokhale bridge at earliest
338.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday asked Western Railway officials to reconstruct Gopal Krishna Gokhale overbridge in Mumbai's Andheri at the earliest. He also directed BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal to ensure proper traffic management. This comes after the area witnessed traffic jams after the dilapidated bridge, which links Andheri East to Andheri West, was shut for traffic on Monday.

339.title: Wish him fruitful tenure ahead: PM to Justice Chandrachud on becoming CJI
339.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated Justice DY Chandrachud for being sworn in as the 50th Chief Justice of India (CJI). "Wishing him a fruitful tenure ahead," PM Modi tweeted. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal also congratulated the new CJI. "May he successfully uphold the cause of law and justice in our society in the times to come," CM Kejriwal tweeted.

340.title: Gadkari apologises for bad road being built for ₹400 crore in MP, crowd applauds
340.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari put out a public apology for what he said was a poorly built stretch of highway in Madhya Pradesh. "Part of the road stretch- a two lane project from Barela to Mandla- is being built at ₹400 crore but I'm not satisfied with it," he said. Gadkari's apology was followed by applause from the crowd.

341.title: Ayushmann Khurrana unveils first look of his film 'An Action Hero'
341.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana shared the first look of his upcoming film 'An Action Hero', which is scheduled to hit the theatres on December 2 this year. The actor had previously called the "slick action and offbeat satire" film as "genre-breaker" for him. Directed by Anirudh Iyer, the film will be produced by Colour Yellow Productions and T-Series.

342.title: Rohit, Rahul bat in old-fashioned way, India need to be dynamic: Hussain
342.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul have batted in an "old fashioned" way during the first few overs in the T20 World Cup 2022. "India need to be more dynamic if they're going to win World Cups," added Hussain. "India have underperformed in...tournaments," he stated. India will face England in their T20 World Cup 2022 semi-final.

343.title: Party that breaks country now doing Bharat Jodo Yatra: K'taka CM
343.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra, saying that the same party that breaks the country into pieces is now doing Bharat Jodo Yatra. "Congress Party's policy is to divide and rule," CM Bommai added. Rahul Gandhi concluded the Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra last month.

344.title: Skye Air Mobility raises $1.7 mn in a round led by Chiratae Ventures
344.article_body: Drone delivery startup Skye Air Mobility has secured $1.7 million in seed round led by Chiratae Ventures. The funding round saw participation from investors like Lead Angels, O2 Angels, Agility Ventures and LetsVenture. Angel investors including Curefoods Founder Ankit Nagori and Mamaearth Co-founder Varun Alagh also participated. The firm was co-founded by Chandra Prakash and Swapnik Jakkampudi.

345.title: 58-yr-old man falls in pit dug for Worli-Sewri connector in Mumbai, dies
345.article_body: A 58-year-old man, Pradeep Dhondu Ambekar, died after falling into a 10-feet deep uncovered pit in Mumbai's Worli on Monday evening. Police said the pit was dug by a contractor engaged by Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) for construction of Worli-Sewri connector flyover. "We are yet to register any offence...and will record statement of the family members," police said.

346.title: Tabu says Babita Kapoor used to call her & Karisma 'hit pair of cinema'
346.article_body: Actress Tabu recalled that Karisma Kapoor and Kareena Kapoor Khan's mother Babita Kapoor used to call her and Karisma the "hit pair of cinema". Tabu and Karisma have featured in 'Saajan Chale Sasural', 'Biwi No.1' and other films. Tabu's next film is 'The Crew', starring Kareena. "I'm certain I'll derive a lot of happiness and joy from...this film," she said.

347.title: Congress is guarantee of instability, corruption & scams: PM Modi
347.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi said that the Congress is the guarantee of instability, corruption and scams. "Congress can never give a stable govt to Himachal Pradesh and neither do they want," PM Modi said. "Congress has only two states left, Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh, no news of development comes from these two states," he added.

348.title: Hyd's Hussain Sagar Lake to get musical fountains ahead of Formula E race
348.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) will install musical floating fountains in Hussain Sagar Lake ahead of Formula E race.
