The fountains will be installed on NTR Marg roadside at an estimated cost of ₹17.02 crore. The HMDA is in the process of finding agencies for supply, installation and commissioning of fountains with operation and maintenance period of three years.

349.title: SRK gave me a career advice, I highly swear by it: Abhishek Bachchan
349.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan recalled an advice given by actor Shah Rukh Khan during his initial career days and added he "highly" swears by it. "[SRK said], 'Ask yourself....if whatever you're doing right now isn't your favourite, then why are you...doing it? Don't focus on what [will] happen in future...focus on your present...give your 100% to it'," Abhishek added.

350.title: 26-yr-old Hyd man hangs himself on live video call with lover
350.article_body: A Hyderabad man died by suicide after hanging himself from a ceiling fan while on a live video call with the girl he loved, after their families rejected their marriage. The deceased, 26-year-old Mohd Tabrez Ali, was in love with a woman from his neighbourhood for the last year. He made a video call to her before hanging himself.

351.title: Stones pelted at local train in Thane, 3 passengers injured
351.article_body: Three passengers were injured after unidentified persons pelted stones at a local train in Thane near Kalwa, Railway police said on Wednesday. The incident took place around 8 pm on Tuesday, after which the injured were taken to a hospital for treatment, an official said. A member of the railway advisory committee demanded increased surveillance and action against the culprits.

352.title: Centre could trim spending for the first time in 3 years: Report
352.article_body: The Union Government could spend less than budgeted for the first time in three years in the current fiscal, according to a report. The total expenditure for 2022-23 could be approximately ₹70,000 crore to ₹80,000 crore less than the budgeted ₹39.45 lakh crore. The government is reportedly keen to meet a fiscal deficit target of 6.4% of the GDP.

353.title: Mumbai's special court refuses ED's request to stay Sanjay Raut's bail
353.article_body: A special court in Mumbai refused the Enforcement Directorate's request to stay Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's bail on Wednesday. Raut was granted bail in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project earlier today. The court has also granted bail to his co-accused Pravin Raut and both of them will be released.

354.title: PCMC begins confiscating moveable assets of property tax defaulters
354.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) started confiscating moveable assets of residents who have dubious record of defaulting on property tax amounting to ₹1 lakh or more for years. According to a PCMC official, 8,791 residents owe PCMC ₹1 lakh or more in property tax dues. Some citizens have not paid their dues for more than seven years, the official added.

355.title: Priyanka Chopra praises CM Yogi's UP govt, says 'I saw a big change here'
355.article_body: UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador Priyanka Chopra has praised CM Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government for its responsible attitude towards women and improvement in their condition in the state. The actress, who'd reached Lucknow for a UNICEF programme, said, "I saw a big change here. In fact, UP needed this change." "Today, maximum number of girls are going...school in [UP]," she added.

356.title: Rare to be cast alongside women you admire: Kriti on 'The Crew'
356.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that it is rare to be cast in a film alongside "women you admire" in an industry where "male-dominated films rule the box office". The actress, who'll be seen in Rhea Kapoor's 'The Crew', said she was "thrilled" to be sharing screen space with Tabu and Kareena Kapoor Khan in the comedy-drama film.

357.title: Mondelēz halts ads on Twitter citing hate speech after Musk takeover
357.article_body: Oreo cookies maker Mondelēz International has halted ads on Twitter citing the increase in hate speech after Elon Musk's takeover of the social media platform. Mondelēz CEO Dirk Van de Put said, "What we've seen recently since the change on Twitter has been announced, is the amount of hate speech increase significantly...our advertising would appear next to the wrong messages."

358.title: Malaika celebrates son Arhaan's 20th b'day, calls him 'grown-up man'
358.article_body: Malaika Arora shared her son Arhaan Khan's unseen pictures on Instagram to wish him on his 20th birthday. "My baby boy is a grown up man today, but will always be my baby," she captioned the post, which received reactions from Malaika's friends, including Kareena Kapoor Khan. Malaika's sister Amrita Arora also wished Arhaan and called him her "constant".

359.title: Films never fail, its the budgets that fail: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai
359.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, speaking about the failure of a film, said, "There's a saying in the film industry, 'Films never fail, its budget fails'. Budgets make the film fail." He added that understanding a film's budget is important as many films fail because of it. "If you make a film of ₹200 crore...your film collects....₹100 crore...it's a flop," he added.

360.title: Thief falls unconscious after running into glass window with stolen bags from US LV store
360.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was caught on video running into a glass window as he attempted to escape with goods stolen from a Louis Vuitton store in Seattle. According to the police, the 17-year-old suspect grabbed handbags worth $18,000 off displays. The video showed the teenager collapsing to the floor unconscious after hitting the glass window.

361.title: 22-yr-old woman pushed to death from 3rd floor by ex-boyfriend in Noida
361.article_body: A 22-year-old woman died after her ex-boyfriend pushed her from the third floor of an office building in Noida, police said. The incident occurred when the accused, who was also her colleague, was trying to force her into staying in his contact. He had fled with her body to Ghaziabad and was going towards Meerut when the police nabbed him.

362.title: Pune man booked under SC/ST Act for hurling casteist slurs at tenant
362.article_body: A real estate developer has been booked under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act for hurling casteist remarks at a tenant in Pune. According to the FIR, Malojirao Rangrao Kakade also threatened the complainant, Vijay Gaikwad, with dire consequences when he questioned about a rent agreement. Notably, Kakade had earlier accused Gaikwad of attempting to extort ₹2 lakh from him.

363.title: NZ allocates $12 million in climate funding for developing nations
363.article_body: New Zealand will allocate $12 million in climate funding to address loss and damage in developing countries. Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta said the country will work with its Pacific partners to support their priorities. Mahuta added that New Zealand recognises that loss and damage for Pacific countries take many forms like culture, language, mental health and physical wellbeing.

364.title: PM Modi stops convoy to let ambulance pass in Himachal Pradesh, video goes viral
364.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who was in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday for election campaign, stopped his convoy for an ambulance to pass in Chambi. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media. The video showed the ambulance speeding by as PM Modi and his convoy waited for it to pass and then made their way ahead.

365.title: Lotus is 'aasan' of Maa Lakshmi: BJP on Cong’s criticism of G20 logo
365.article_body: Responding to Congress' criticism of India's logo for the presidency of the G20, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla on Wednesday said that the lotus is the country's national flower. He also said that Goddess Lakshmi is also seated on a lotus. "Rajiv (Gandhi) also means Kamal. Hope you see no agenda there," Poonawalla said.

366.title: Which are Asia's best universities according to the latest QS rankings?
366.article_body: China's Peking University topped the QS Asia University Rankings 2023 with an overall score of 100. It dethroned last year's number-one university, the National University of Singapore, which took the second spot this year. Nineteen Indian institutes and universities feature among the top 200 in Asia, with IIT Bombay ranked the best in India.

367.title: Serving people is my priority: Justice Chandrachud after taking oath as CJI
367.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud, who was sworn in as the 50th CJI on Wednesday, said his first priority would be to serve the common man and bring in reforms in the Supreme Court registry. President Droupadi Murmu administered the oath of office to the new CJI at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. Justice Chandrachud will serve as the CJI for two years.

368.title: Ex-MP CM Nath who burnt Sikhs was honoured on Guru Nanak Jayanti: Sikh singer
368.article_body: A video of singer Manpreet Singh Kanpuri, criticising the decision to honour former MP CM Kamal Nath on the occasion of Guru Nanak Jayanti in Indore, has gone viral. In the video, Kanpuri said that a person "who burnt Sikhs by putting tyres around their neck" was called to the event, adding, "Guru Nanak is watching."

369.title: Malaika & I have learned to accept each other's choices: Arbaaz Khan
369.article_body: Actor Arbaaz Khan, speaking about his ex-wife Malaika Arora, has said, "She's been mature about a lot of things and fortunately, I have been as well." He added that they both have learned to accept each other's choices. "We have one common interest...that's our child...he doesn't deserve...any kind of scenario where there's a discord while he's growing up," he added.

370.title: Kalpataru, Dynamix & NL Dalmia jointly launch a luxury tower in Mira Rd
370.article_body: Kalpataru Group, along with Dynamix & NL Dalmia, stated that they have redefined Mumbai's Mira Road's market with Srishti township since 1985. Seeking to set a new benchmark with Srishti Namaah, the group announced the launch of a luxury tower of spacious homes with lavish decks, 180° views & 40+ world-class amenities, which is 5 minutes from Western Express Highway.

371.title: Salesforce confirms laying off hundreds of employees
371.article_body: Enterprise software firm Salesforce has laid off hundreds of employees on "accountability" issues. Several others are also likely to be put on a 30-day review, with the aim to let them go after a month. "Our sales performance process drives accountability. Unfortunately, that can lead to some leaving the business, and we support them through their transition." Salesforce stated.

372.title: Worried about Rohit, he's just hanging the bat outside off-stump: Hogg
372.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said he is "worried" about Rohit Sharma, who has scored 89 runs in the T20 World Cup 2022 so far. "He has got too much on his plate...I don't think I have seen...solid footwork...[since he became Team India's captain]...He is just hanging the bat outside off-stump and hoping that he finds the middle," added Hogg.

373.title: Cognizant says it fired 6% employees in Q2 due to failed background checks
373.article_body: Cognizant India has revealed that they had a 6% involuntary attrition in the quarter ended September. The company's India head Rajesh Nambiar said the high involuntary attrition was due to failed background checks. "They don't have the right background to continue in that role. We have no tolerance for anyone who doesn't clear background checks," he mentioned.

374.title: India to become world's third-largest economy by 2027: Morgan Stanley
374.article_body: India is on a path to surpass Japan and Germany to become the world's third-largest economy by 2027, according to a Morgan Stanley report. The report said India's GDP could more than double from $3.5 trillion today to surpass $7.5 trillion by 2031. The BSE could reach a market capitalisation of $10 trillion in the coming decade, the report said.

375.title: Don't make not having Twitter blue tick the new cool: Nikhil Kamath to Musk
375.article_body: Zerodha Co-Founder Nikhil Kamath spoke against Elon Musk offering verification badges on Twitter for $8 monthly subscription saying, "When you make exclusivity publicly accessible, it's no longer exclusivity." Tagging Musk, he added, "Elon Musk, don't make not having a verified badge the new cool (for Twitter's sake)." The subscription has been rolled out in US, Canada, Australia and New Zealand.

376.title: Insurtech platform Plum lays off 36 employees
376.article_body: Sequoia and Tiger Global-backed insurtech platform Plum has laid off 36 employees owing to tough market conditions in the startup ecosystem, Co-Founders Abhishek Poddar and Saurabh Arora said. The laid off staff will be given support such as severance pay, healthcare benefits, well-being counselling and Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), they added. Plum raised $15.6 million in May 2021.

377.title: 5 undertrials booked following clashes at Yerawada Central Prison in Pune
377.article_body: Five undertrials lodged at Pune's Yerawada Central Prison were booked on the charges of unlawful assembly, assault and rioting after clashes broke out inside the prison on Tuesday. The clashes led to stone pelting among inmates and assault on prison employees. The incident occurred in barrack numbers 27 and 31 and near the prison infirmary, Yerawada police station officials said.

378.title: Kejriwal's govt collected ₹1,286 cr as green cess, utilised nothing: BJP's Lekhi
378.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi criticised the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in Delhi alleging that his government has collected ₹1,286 crore from people as Environment Cess and it has not been utilised for improving the condition. She further accused AAP government of showing sheer negligence and said, "Delhi needs a full-time CM. This part-time CM has shown no concern for Delhi."

379.title: Man robs, rapes Noida woman after meeting her on 'Jeevansathi.com'; held
379.article_body: Noida Police on Tuesday said that they had arrested a Ghaziabad man for cheating a woman of ₹30 lakh and raping her after befriending her on 'Jeevansathi.com'. The accused posed as a senior officer at Airtel and took ₹30 lakh from the woman, saying that his sister was suffering from cancer, said Additional DCP (Noida) Ashutosh Dwivedi.

380.title: BMC to close SV Road bridge in Malad, sends notices to vacate shops
380.article_body: After declaring SV Road bridge in Malad dilapidated in 2019, BMC has now sent notices to the shopowners sitting on the alignment of the bridge to vacate their shops. The corporation had completed tendering for its reconstruction but the construction could not be started as the shopowners refused to shift, an official said. They are reportedly unhappy with the compensation.

381.title: Eureka Forbes announces new chief product and technology officer, CFO
381.article_body: Eureka Forbes (EFL) said it has appointed Shubham Srivastava as the Chief Product and Technology Officer and Gaurav Khandelwal as the Chief Financial Officer (CFO). The company said Srivastava will drive digital transformation, while Khandelwal will lead the finance, commercial, legal and secretarial functions. Khandelwal has earlier worked with companies like Hindustan Unilever, Airtel and Oyo.

382.title: Measles outbreak confirmed in Mumbai slum after 3 kids die
382.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has confirmed the outbreak of measles in Govandi's Rafi Nagar slum, which lies in the M/East ward in Mumbai. This comes after three children aged between one and five died in the area after developing rashes and fever. A BMC official said six cases of the contagious disease have been confirmed in Rafi Nagar.

383.title: N Korea fired ballistic missile towards eastern sea: S Korea
383.article_body: North Korea fired a short-range ballistic missile towards its eastern sea from Sukchon, Seoul’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said. Last week, North Korea launched missiles in response to joint drills conducted by South Korea and the US. South Korea’s military said it recovered debris of one of the North Korean missiles determined to be a Soviet-era anti-aircraft weapon.

384.title: Pune girl declared brain-dead after accident, family donates her organs
384.article_body: The parents of a 10-year-old girl donated her organs and saved three persons' lives when she was declared brain-dead after a road accident in Pune. Her heart was donated to a one-year-old girl in Mumbai, while her kidney and liver were donated to a 37-year-old woman and seven-year-old girl, respectively. The girl was hit by a speeding moped in October.

385.title: I was very scared when I posted it: Samantha on revealing about myositis diagnosis
385.article_body: Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently posted a picture showing IV drips attached to her as she dubbed for 'Yashoda' and revealed she was diagnosed with an autoimmune condition, myositis. She said, "I was very scared when I posted it. I was already weak and vulnerable, and I didn't know if I'd enough strength to take if somebody said a wrong thing."

386.title: Man weighing 153 kg granted bail, court says 'obesity is root cause of other diseases'
386.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to a money laundering accused, noting that he's an 'obese' person who weighs 153 kg. Considering his co-morbidities, it can be said that he falls in the exception of being "sick", the court noted. It took note of doctors' opinion and said obesity is the "root cause of several other diseases".

387.title: China factory prices drop for 1st time in 2 years amid COVID-19 curbs
387.article_body: China's factory gate prices or producer price index (PPI) fell by 1.3% year-on-year for October, its first decline since December 2020, the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) data showed on Wednesday. This was driven by faltering domestic demand amid COVID-19 curbs, a property slump and global recession risk hitting the economy. Consumer inflation moderated from a 29-month high in September.

388.title: 16-yr-old B'luru student dies by suicide after being caught cheating
388.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in Bengaluru died after he allegedly jumped from the 14th floor of an apartment building on Tuesday, hours after he was caught cheating during a test. According to reports, some residents tried dissuading him from taking the extreme step when he went to the apartment building where his friend lived after sneaking out of his school.

389.title: Kerala govt to remove Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as universities' Chancellor
389.article_body: Kerala government on Wednesday decided to bring in an ordinance to remove Governor Arif Mohammed Khan as the Chancellor of state-run universities. The government is planning to appoint an expert from the education sector for the Chancellor's post. The decision came following several arguments between Khan and the state government in recent months over the administration of universities.

390.title: What is wrong with a fielder faking he has got the ball in his hands: Sunil Gavaskar
390.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that fake fielding should be considered as part of the deception that the game of cricket has. Gavaskar said that bowlers and batters try to deceive each other using various measures, adding, "Then what's wrong with a fielder faking he has got the ball in his hands when he actually doesn't have it."

391.title: Leave Twitter before it's too late: Actor Mark Ruffalo to Elon Musk
391.article_body: Actor Mark Ruffalo once again called out Elon Musk for his policies at Twitter and tweeted, "Leave Twitter before it's too late…never mind. It's too late. Billionaire Hubris syndrome." Ruffalo also criticised Musk for breaking his promise to keep Twitter "politically neutral" and recommending voting for Republicans. "He (Musk) speaks with a forked tongue," tweeted Ruffalo.

392.title: Twitter's top exec Yoel Roth once worked at an Apple store fixing Mac computers
392.article_body: Twitter's Head of Safety and Integrity Yoel Roth once worked at an Apple store fixing Mac computers and joined Twitter in 2015. While Roth has become the public face of Twitter's content moderation since Elon Musk took over, the latter also suggested people follow Roth’s Twitter feed for an "accurate" understanding of what’s happening with trust and safety at Twitter.

393.title: Robbers push passenger out of moving train in Bihar; 2nd incident in 4 days
393.article_body: A 34-year-old man, travelling in Tatanagar link Express, was pushed out of a moving train by armed robbers on Tuesday night between Barauni-Khagaria rail sections of Samastipur rail division, the police said. The victim was standing near the gate to de-board the train at Barauni when the incident happened. A similar incident occurred in Katihar-Barauni sections on November 5.

394.title: Sanjay, Sunny, Jackie and Mithun's 1st look from 'Baap' revealed; people say '80s are back'
394.article_body: The first look of Sanjay Dutt, Sunny Deol, Jackie Shroff and Mithun Chakraborty from the movie 'Baap' has been revealed. Reacting to the picture, social media users wrote, "I am loving the whole 80s action star vibes in this poster," and, "Dammmnnn the 90s me is getting legit excited." "This is going to be legendary," another user wrote.

395.title: 24-yr-old woman gets man arrested for molesting her twice in Mumbai Metro
395.article_body: A 24-year-old woman, with the help of another passenger, got a 29-year-old man arrested for molesting her twice inside the Mumbai Metro while she was on her way to work, police said. The accused bumped into the victim once, officials said, adding that he later stood behind the woman in the metro and sexually abused her.

396.title: Threw up every time SRK removed his shirt in 'Dard-E-Disco': Farah
396.article_body: Director-choreographer Farah Khan shared that during the filming of Om Shanti Om's 'Dard-E-Disco' song, she'd "throw up every time" Shah Rukh Khan would remove his shirt. She remembered that it was the first time when Shah Rukh showcased his six-pack abs on screen. Farah added that people said the film wouldn't work, but she was very sure about it.

397.title: He told me 'You've screwed us the most': Referee on sending Pique off
397.article_body: Discussing his decision to show a red card to Barcelona defender Gerard Pique in his final appearance for the club against Osasuna, referee Gil Manzano said, "Pique told me, 'You're the referee who's screwed us the most'." "Pique continued to repeat the same expressions...He said, 'It's a f***ing shame'," added Manzano. Pique was sent off from the bench at half-time.

398.title: Driffle raises $3.4 million in seed funding round led by BEENEXT
398.article_body: Digital gaming marketplace Driffle has secured $3.4 million in a seed round led by venture capital firm BEENEXT. Other investors including JAFCO Asia, Taurus Ventures, Better Capital and White Venture Capital raised funds. The funding round also saw participation from Cred Founder Kunal Shah, Global Chief Strategy Officer at OYO Maninder Gulati, StayVista Co-founder Amit Damani among others.

399.title: Bitcoin briefly falls to its lowest since Nov 2020 amid Binance-FTX deal
399.article_body: Bitcoin fell to $17,300.80 on Tuesday, the lowest level since November 2020, triggered by reports of the cryptocurrency exchange Binance taking over its rival FTX. Bitcoin rose by 6% initially following the takeover announcement but then fell as investors were worried about FTX’s balance sheet. Bitcoin was trading over 7% lower at $18,372.07 around 11.55 am on Wednesday, Coinbase showed.

400.title: Sanjay Raut gets bail in Patra Chawl money laundering case
400.article_body: A Mumbai court on Wednesday granted bail to Shiv Sena leader and MP Sanjay Raut in a money laundering case pertaining to the Patra Chawl redevelopment project. The Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Raut in July this year for his alleged role in financial irregularities in connection with the redevelopment of the Patra Chawl.
